loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
This is Susana, 44, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, a tricycle driver. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Susana operates a mobile store. Her mobile store is basically a small homewares store which retails plastic containers, dippers, pails, plastic flowers and basins to the local neighborhood. Her husband drives the mobile store within the local community to sell the products. Susana gets supplies at wholesale prices and sells by the piece. Her regular customers are locals. She earns a minimum of Php 1120 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy pails, plasticware, hangers, clothes pins, plastic flowers and rags to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Susana hopes to be able to expand soon and to be a successful business woman. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is Nancy, 49, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Lolito, a Values Formation Officer. She is the mother of three children: one is already working and two are in college. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nancy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. Nancy buys supplies at wholesale prices and sells by the piece. Aside from the variety store, she is also into direct sales. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk and Marikina Shoe Exchange. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are locals. She earns a minimum of Php 566 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. A portion of the loan will be used to buy bags, wallets, shoes, watches and cosmetics for her direct selling business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nancy hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to provide for the daily needs of her family and give her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries needed in her business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 53 years old.  She is married and has 6 children, 1 of whom is in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines.  She has been raising livestock for 23 years now, and has borrowed and repaid 19 loans in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Helen has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise and sell.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more livestock

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 42 years old.  She is married and has 3 children. With 2 children in school, she works very hard to provide for her family.

Marjorie runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, snack food, soap, etc.  She has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as sardines, grocery items, etc. in her sari-sari store.

In the future, Marjorie would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood sales business in the Philippines.  She also earns additional income from selling fruits and farming sugarcane. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her firewood sales business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 28 years old.  She is married and has 2 children.  

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and has been running this business  for 6 years.  She also earns additional income from fish vending.

Gina has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store. She has borrowed and repaid 4 previous loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Gina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: El señor Abel  oriundo de villa Carmen de Cochabamba, vive con la Sra. Laura y tienen dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, su domicilio propio se encuentra ubicado en limoncito zona el torno, es de ocupación taxista, trabaja en el torno, hace unos dos años se dedica a esta labor transportando pasajeros de el Torno a Santa Cruz, el destino del crédito es para refaccionar su vivienda ya que quiere hacer construir cuartos para brindar una mayor comodidad a su familia, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le a brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Abel is originally from Villa Carmen in Cochabamba. He lives with Sra. Laura and they have two children who are of school age. They own a home in Limoncito in the District of El Torno. Abel is a taxi driver and works in El Torno. He has been in this job for approximately two years and his work involves driving passengers from El Torno to Santa Cruz.

This loan will be used to repair his home. Abel also wants to build rooms so that his family will be more comfortable. He is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to pay for home repairs and to build additional rooms in his house.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa, age 62, is a widow with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs, a business in which she has been engaged for a year now. She earns an additional income from food vending.

Teresa is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Felix Ernesto

texts.es: El señor Félix, vive en su propio domicilio ubicado en la zona la guardia,  es nacido en Santa Cruz, tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, es de ocupación moto taxista, trabaja hace unos cuatro años en esta actividad,  el destino del crédito es para comprar una moto nueva y trabajarla, generándole otros ingresos,  de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y de toda su familia, su deseo es el de ver a sus hijos convertidos en personas de bien y profesionales, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le brindo.
texts.en:
Sr. Félix lives in his own home in the District of La Guardia, but he was born in Santa Cruz. He has three children who are of school age. Félix is a motorcycle taxi driver and has been in this business for approximately four years.

This loan will be used to buy a new motorcycle to use for his work and generating additional income. This will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his entire family. His hope is to see his children become good people and successful professionals. Félix is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: El señor Denis se dedica a la serigrafía en cuero, fabrica las etiquetas para los pantalones jeans de damas, varones, niños, y vende a los confeccionistas para entregar sus prendas de vestir a las distintas tiendas y mercados de la ciudad, también fabrica cinturones de cuero para comercializar en los distintos mercados de la ciudad, el dinero del credito se utilizara para la compra de cuero, su negocio queda ubicado en su mismo domicilio, el tiene 21 años nacido en santa cruz es un joven emprendedor con ganas de superación agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que  le brindo para que el joven pueda salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sr. Denis makes leather screen prints and manufactures labels used for women’s, men’s, and children’s jeans. His products are sold to apparel manufacturers who deliver their clothes to different stores and markets in the city. Denis also makes leather belts that are sold at the various city markets.

The money from this loan will be used to buy leather. Denis operates his business out of his home. He is 21 years old and was born in Santa Cruz. This young entrepreneur has the drive to succeed and with the support of Emprender he will be able to move forward.

loans.use: to purchase leather for making screen prints, clothing labels, and belts.

loans.name: 54 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Mrs T. has a retail business selling medication. She is requesting a loan to purchase medicine to resell.

T. is 58 years old and is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.
T. is the group leader of the 54 Thieu Do solidarity group which consists of 4 members. 

This is T.'s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
T. has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that T. faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profit, T. hopes to be abL. to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, to remodel her house and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase medicine to resell

loans.name: 57 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Mrs Duyen operates a herd of cattL.. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

Duyen is 51 years old and is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents. Duyen is the group leader of the 57 Thieu Do solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 

This is Duyen's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Duyen has been involved in this business for 8 years.
The main hardship that Duyen faces in her business are natural disasters and droughts.

With her business profit, Duyen hopes to buy land of her own, to be abL. to buy more supplies and equipment for her business and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 48 years old and has a fish selling business. She buys fresh fish and makes dried and salted fish. Nilda sells her products to the people in her community.

Nilda has 5 children and the oldest is 21 years old. Nilda works hard to support her family and to send her children to school.

Nilda has requested this loan to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to have a stable business that will help sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: 58 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hai operates a food stall, selling pork pies and fermented pork rolls. She is requesting a loan to purchase pork pies and fermented pork rolls to resell.

Hai is 36 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

Hai is the group leader of the 58 Thieu Do solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

This is Hai's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Hai has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hai hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to be abL. to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase pork pies and fermented pork rolls to resell.

loans.name: Viet

texts.en: Viet is 48 years old. She lives in Dong Thon village. She has three children who are grown. She is a farmer. Not only does she grow rice, but also she raises pigs. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnam dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2009. The last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,288,000 VND to raise pigs and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy food for the pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for the pigs.

loans.name: Kanymkul's Group

texts.en: Kanymkul is the leader of this group. She is 53 and married to the local school teacher. Together with her husband, she has raised six children: three daughters and three sons. The youngest son studies at school and all the other children are married and live separately with their families. In order to earn money to meet their needs, the family breeds livestock. Kanymkul sells six or seven liters of milk a day; in this way, she earns about 3,000 soms per month. Kanymkul applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds to increase the number of livestock. She wants to purchase 10 livestock animals for breeding. In the future, with the profits gained from reselling livestock, Kanymkul wants to repair the house. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: 59 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuy works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattL.. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Thuy is 22 years old and is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

Thuy is the group leader of the 59 Thieu Do solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

This is Thuy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Thuy has been involved in this business for two years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her are illnesses.

In the future, Thuy hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy land of her own, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Wilfredo Valerio

texts.es: El sr. Wilfredo, es un cliente nuevo, con buena referencia crediticia, se dedica a la elaboración de bolsitas de polietileno para liquidos de toda medida a petición de los clientes. El sr Wilfredo es un cliente muy trabajador con mucha experiencia, hace 20 años que inicio su actividad y oficio, con la elaboración de bolsas de polietileno, razón por la cual llegó a equipar su taller con todos los equipos necesarios como: extrusora, selladoras de todas medidas, todo esto con la ayuda de su familia, que siempre esta y estará a su lado, Don Wilfredo, vive en  la zona achachicala, desde hace mucho tiempo es bueno también señalar que don wilfredo es  la primera vez que trabaja con una institución financiera, razón por la cual esta entusiasmado en trabajar con " emprender"  y espera sacar montos mas altos con el transcurrir del tiempo, con el dinero del crédito comprara materia prima para la fabricación de las bolsas.
texts.en:
Sr. Wilfredo is a new client who has good credit references. He manufactures polyethylene bags that are used to hold liquids of various amounts. These products are made at the request of his customers. Sr. Wilfredo is a hardworking gentleman who has plenty of experience. He started his business 20 years ago. In order to develop these polyethylene bags, he had to furnish his workshop with all the necessary equipment such as an extruder and sealers of all sizes. Wilfredo is able to perform his work with the help of his family, who is always by his side. He has lived in the District of Achachicala for a long time.

It is noteworthy to point out that this is the first time Don Wilfredo has worked with a financial institution. For this reason, he is excited about working with Emprender and hopes to acquire larger loans over time. The money from this loan will be used to buy materials for making the polyethylene bags.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making polyethylene bags.

loans.name: 56 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Linh has a retail business, selling plastic goods. She is requesting a loan to purchase plastic goods for resaL..

Linh is 35 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

Linh is the group leader of the 56 Thieu Do solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

This is Linh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Linh has been involved in this business for four years. The main hardship that Linh faces in her business is not being abL. to meet the high demand for products.

With her business profit, Linh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy a motorbike, and to be abL. to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase plastic goods for resale.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mrs. Van, age 50, lives in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. To earn a living, she and her husband plant and harvest crops, thereby earning around $2 in profit to be used toward providing for the needs of the family. The couple is shown here with their youngest child. They have ten children, one of whom is married and living separately. 

In order to generate additional income, four of their children are employed as garment factory workers and contribute their monthly salaries to the family. 

Mrs. Van is requesting a loan with which she will make essential repairs to the old house in which the family lives.

loans.use: to make essential repairs to the old house in which the family lives

loans.name: 60 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thoa  works in agriculture farming poultry and cattL.. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

Thoa is 53 years old and is married with 1 child. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.
Thoa is the group leader of the 60 Thieu Do solidarity group which consists of 4 members. 

This is Thoa first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Thoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is illness.

In the future, Thoa hopes for her business to do well, to be abL. to buy more supplies and equipment for her business and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Gulshaiyr's Group

texts.en:
Gulshaiyr is the treasurer of this group. She is 38 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she brings up four daughters: the two older daughters study at school and the other two daughters are of preschool age (under seven). Five years ago the family started to breed livestock to resell at a higher price after fattening. With the profits gained from this activity, Gulshaiyr purchased home furniture and household appliances. She applied for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future she hopes to expand her business and improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La Sra. Julia tiene 49 años de edad tiene casa propia  Zona 3 pasos al frente donde hace 20 años que se compro su casita, tiene 2 hijos y ella vive con el menor de sus hijos. La Señora hace 9 años que se compro su micro para darlo a trabajar en la línea  en la cual percibe su renta diaria, y también vende productos de una empresa muy conocida,  con eso se ayuda con los gasto de la familia. "el crédito que se le otorgo fue para realizarle mantenimiento en general a su micro" (compra de llantas, accesorios y otros), Doña Julia quedo muy agradecida con nuestra institución por la oportunidad que se le dio al otorgarle dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia is 49 years old and owns a home in District 3 that she purchased 20 years ago. She has two children and lives with the younger one.

Nine years ago, Sra. Julia purchased a microbus so that she could operate a route that generates a daily income. She also sells products from a well-known company to help with the family expenses.

The loan being provided will be used to pay for general maintenance of her microbus (purchase tires, accessories, and other items). Doña Julia is very grateful to Emprender for giving her the opportunity to receive this loan.

loans.use: to purchase tires, accessories, and pay for maintenance of her microbus.

loans.name: Cu

texts.en: Cu is 51 years old. She lives in Dong Thon village with her husband and two children. Her main job is growing rice and breeding pigs and poultry. She has had this job for 31 years. She has a monthly income of about 4.000.000 Vietnamdong(VND). She always needs loans to invest in livestock. So, she has participated in SEDA since 2009. The last cycle, she borrowed 8.288.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9.184.000 VND to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Turdi

texts.en:
Turdi lives and works in Shahrituz, Tajikistan. He is married and the father of five children. His wife is a housewife. Turdi is engaged in cultivating crops such as water-melon, onion and corn. Turdi has been running his farming business for 30 years and he has a lot of experience in this business. His sons and daughter help him to plant seeds. Turdi would like a loan of 10,000 TJS to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer to increase his working capital.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Manfredo

texts.es: El sr.  Manfredo vive en la zona Virgen de lujan hace 7 años en su casa propia, convive con la Sra. Casilda y sus 4 hijos, los cuales dos estan a su cargo. Don Manfredo lleva 9 años con la actividad del transporte es socio de la línea y el personalmente lo trabaja su micro ya que así de esta forma mantiene y cuida su herramienta de trabajo que es su micro. El crédito que se le otorgo fue para el mantenimiento de su micro (cambio de balatas, cambio de llantas, y tapizado). “el Sr. esta agradecido por la rapidez en que se le otorgo el crédito y la confianza brindad hacia su persona.
texts.en:
Sr. Manfredo has lived in his own home in the District of Virgen de Lujan for seven years. He is in a common-law relationship with Sra. Casilda and they have four children, two of whom are still under their care. Don Manfredo has been in the transportation business for nine years. He is a member of a travel line network and personally drives a microbus. Manfredo must maintain and take care of his vehicle since it is the main piece of equipment that he uses for work.

This loan will be used for the maintenance of his microbus (purchase brake pads, replace the tires, reupholster). Sr. Manfredo appreciates the quick response to his loan request and the trust being demonstrated to him as a person.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his microbus.

loans.name: 61 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Mrs Binh works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattL.. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattL.-feed.

Binh is 49 years old and is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents. Binh is the group leader of the 61 Thieu Do solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

This is Binh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Binh has been involved in this business for 5 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Binh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy land of her own and to be abL. to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle-feed

loans.name: Dong Thon-1-02 Group

texts.en:
Que is 35 years old. She is married with two children. Her husband is a carpenter. Her family has a workshop and she works there. She and her husband have worked there for 15 years. They have a monthly income of about 6.000.000 Vietnamdong(VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2009 and has repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8.736.000 VND to buy wood. She is the leader of 5-member group loan in SEDA.
 
About other borrowers in her group.
 Tho is 52 years old. She raises chickens. She wants to borrow 5.152.000 VND to buy food for chicken.
 Hoa is 37 years old. She wants to borrow 8.736.000 VND to buy pigs.
 Lan is 40 years old. She wants to borrow 7.392.000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.
 Ngu is 40 years old. She wants to borrow 8.736.000 VND to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: 62 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Mrs Xuyen works in agriculture, farming food. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer for vegetables and trees.

Xuyen is 31 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents. Xuyen is the group leader of the 62 Thieu Do solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 

This is Xuyen's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Xuyen has been involved in this business for 7 years.
The main hardship that Xuyen L. faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Xuyen L. hopes to remodel her house, to be abL. to buy more supplies and equipment for her business and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for vegetable and trees.

loans.name: 63 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Mrs Chien has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

Chien is 48 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.
Chien is the group leader of the 63 Thieu Do solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

This is Chien's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Chien has been involved in this business for 7 years.
The main hardship that Chien faces in her business is lack of capital.

loans.name: Nurmuhammad

texts.en:
Nurmuhammad is an active and hardworking guy. He is single and lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan with his parents. Nurmuhammad sells children's clothes. He trades in the market of “Khair” in Vahdat city. He has been this business for 3 years and has gained enough experience. Nurmuhammad would like a loan of 9000 TJS to purchase children's clothes to increase his assortment of goods and expand his business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

At the moment she sells foodstuffs, detergents and beverages. Her business runs well and she earns 11000 soms per month. Gulzat applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to purchase more goods such as macaroni, sugar, soda and juices. In the future Gulzat wants to give her children a good education.

Homidchon leases a plot of land, where he grows vegetables, honeydew and watermelons.  He has been involved in this type of business for three years.  Previously, he worked as an accountant for over 15 years.  Homidchon is obtaining this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.  He wants to plant and gather a good harvest.

She earns an additional 4000 soms per month, fattening and reselling animals at the highest price. This profit helped her improve their family’s living conditions. Her challenge is lack of enough capital to buy feed for her poultry.   Her vision is to have two retail shops and to increase the number of birds she rears.  Vasta needs the loan facility to buy birds for rearing.

texts.en:

Julita has had a sari sari store business for 10 years. She sells items like canned sardines and tuna, chips, soft drinks and eggs to people in her community. Julita also bakes bread that she sells at her store. Each month, Julita earns about 9000 PHP from her business.

Julita is requesting a loan of 30000 PHP to buy flour, sugar and more items to sell such as eggs, canned goods and soap. Julita hopes that her business will grow.

texts.en: Wilson is a forty-two year-old married man with five children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been in the poultry business for eight years.  This has enabled him to provide for the family. His hardships are the high costs for feeds and the possibility of diseases. His vision is to raise at least 1000 birds.  He currently has only 220.  Wilson is in need of a loan to buy birds for poultry farming.

loans.use: To buy birds for poultry farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy drugs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a thirty-three year-old hardworking man with one child.  He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has owned an art and stationery shop for seven years.  He started with capital of 300,000 shillings and now has 3,500,000 shillings. His challenge is bad debtors.  His vision is to set up an art gallery, and to own a residential house and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy stationery and T-shirts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Gulraftor

texts.en:
Gulraftor is 41 years old. She is a divorced woman and mother of one child. Gulraftor is a very hardworking and independent woman. She sells foods in her grocery store and has done this for 8 years.  Therefore, she has good business experience. 

With the purpose of expanding the business, Gulraftor is requesting a loan of 12,000TJS, with which she will purchase merchandise.  She will be able to offer a wider selection to her customers and increase her income. Gulraftor sincerely thanks you for your support. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy food

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is 53 years old, married, and lives in the Philippines where for the past two years she has had a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. A member of HSPFI since 2010, Leonila is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more canned goods, beverages and snacks. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Meas' Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas was selected by the other three loan group members as the head of this loan group. She is a villager in Kompong Chhnang province and is a domestic farmer. She also runs a small business selling miscellaneous items. She is the mother of four children, one of whom is married. None of them is employed, so the family depends entirely on Mrs. Meas's daily income and that of her husband. 

Mrs. Meas and her husband have spent their lifetime working in the field. They can generate profits of about US $4.25 each day to cover the family’s basic requirements. 

To earn some additional money to support the family, Mrs. Meas started raising a few piglets in a cage over three months ago, but they are still very small because they lack sufficient food. For this reason, Mrs. Meas is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to buy several sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs.
 
The other borrowers are as follows: 

Mrs. Norng is seeking a loan to purchase fertilizers to ensure the successful growth of her crops.
    
Mrs. Vann, a rice farmer, is looking for a loan to buy pigs for breeding, as well as to purchase fertilizers. 

Mrs. Um, a domestic farmer, is requesting a loan to buy several sacks of fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия жительница Файзабадского района. Ей 43 года. Она разведена. У нее детей нет. Она имеет средне - специальное образование, учительница. По профессии Зулфия проработала 10 лет. На сегодняшний день она у себя дома занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже три года. Кредит берет для приобретения швейной машинки.
texts.en: Zulfiya lives in the Fayzabad district.  She is 43 years old, divorced and has no children.  She has a secondary-specialized education as a teacher.  Zulfiya has worked in her field for 10 years.  Today, she is involved in sewing national dresses at her home.  She has been in this business for three years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Luzviminda has a shop that sells Avon, Natasha and MSE products. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy products from Natasha and Avon to resell.

Luzviminda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy products from Natasha and Avon to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products from Natasha and Avon to resell.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Rosie has a food shop that sells snacks like waffles, rice sweets, roasted hotdogs and homemade sausage. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients needed in making snacks.

Rosie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed in making snacks.

loans.name: Chhaem

texts.en:
From the Reussey Keo area, Mr. Chhaem is a 31-year-old man who has been in the farming business since 2000.  He earns approximately $3 each day.  He has a life partner in his wife, who helps support him in his business. They are blessed with one child, who is studying in the public school and relies on them for support.  

Mr. Chhaem has learned how to produce earthenware jars. He wishes to open a small business to sell these jars but doesn't have enough working capital to run this kinds of business. Therefore, Mr. Chhaem made the decision to apply for a loan from Kiva through HKL to obtain the capital to operate a small business selling earthenware jars.

loans.use: operate his earthenware jars business

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora, a  45-year-old married mother of four children, lives in the Philippines where, for the past five years, she has owned a business providing motorela or habal-habal services, with her husband serving as the driver.  A member of HSPFI since 2006, she is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy tools and pay the utilities for the service. In the future, Flora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay utilities for her habal-habal service.

loans.name: Tursun

texts.ru: Турсун проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст 61 год. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Ее муж и дети находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сама Турсун занимается торговлей на рынке. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает ткани. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 35 лет. Кредит берет для покупки оптом новых видов тканей.
texts.en: Tursun lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 61 years old, married and has six children.  Her husband and children are working in the Russian Federation.  Tursun is involved in fabrics sales at a market.  She leases a retail outlet, where she sells fabrics.  She has been involved in this business for 35 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of new types of fabrics wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase new types of fabrics wholesale

loans.name: Behruz

texts.en:
Behruz lives and works in Kurgantyube, Tajikistan. He is an active and hardworking husband. 

Bejriz is engaged in selling food and daily products. He sells sweets, drinks, sugar, etc. He has been in this business for 6 years and has his own grocery store. Behruz would like to get a loan of 10,500 TJS to purchase more food items in order to increase the assortment of goods in his store and expand his business.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock such as sugar, wheat flour, rice in bulk, maize flour in bulk, etc.

loans.name: Neak

texts.en: Mrs. Neak is from the Keussey Keo community in Phnom Penh City.  She sells items such as soft drinks, sweets, cooking supplies, cigarettes, snack foods, and cosmetic products in front of her home. To share in the responsibility and meet the family’s living expenses, her husband operates a motor taxi service and makes an average income of $4 a day.  This couple has four children, one is a sewing worker who works in factory. Mrs. Neak will be using this loan that she is applying for to buy more items to sell.

loans.use: buy more items to sell

loans.name: Jemmar

texts.en:
Jemmar is 23 years old and married. He has a 2-year-old child. 

Jemmar is a farmer who tills land in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He grows rice crops to sell. Jemmar is also a welder. When free of farming duties, he works at a welding shop in his town.

Jemmar is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. He also plans to buy piglets to start a hog-raising business. He hopes to succeed in his ventures.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Salatiel

texts.fr: Salatiel   est un enseignant, il est âgé de 58 ans, il est marié, et il est né au Rwanda.  Il a 4 enfants  dans son charge et ses enfants sont  entre 19 ans et 25 ans, 3 vont à l’école .Son niveau d’éducation est des études université. C’est son troisième  cycle de prêt avec ACB.  Il va payer les frais des études  pour ses enfants. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est  de facilite ses enfants à accéder aux études supérieur pour qu’ils préparent leurs futures. Dans l’avenir il voudrait avoir une famille bien éduqué, et assure le développement  de sa famille.
texts.en: Salatiel is an educator. He is 58 years old and married. He is born in Rwanda. He has four dependent children, from 19 to 25 years of age, three of whom study. He has a university degree. This is his third loan cycle with ACB. He is going to pay tuition costs for his children. His strategy is to support his children in getting a higher education in order to prepare for the future. He would like to have a well-educated family and be able to improve their life conditions.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his children

loans.name: Olimkhon

texts.ru: Олимхон проживает в районе Яван. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него 8 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Трое его сыновей находятся в России на заработках. Сам Олимхон работает преподавателем в средней школе района. В этой области он работает более 20 лет. Одновременно он занимается растениеводством. У себя дома выращивает овощи. Кроме того Олимхон занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Olimkhon lives in the Yavan district.  He is 54 years old, married and has eight children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Three of his sons work in Russia.  Olimkhon works as a teacher at the local, district secondary school.  He has been working in this field for over 20 years.  At the same time, he is involved in agriculture and grows vegetables at home.  Besides this, Olimkhon is also involved in animal husbandry.  He breeds cattle for subsequent resale.  He has been in this business six years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Resielda

texts.en:
Resielda is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Resielda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and rice per kilogram. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Resielda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Ma. Rita

texts.en:
Ma. Rita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Ma. Rita has a retail shop that sells canned goods, breads, snacks, bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks for store expansion & additional foods to sell.

Ma. Rita has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks for store expansion & additional foods to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 28 years old and married to Jane.

He has been running his cereals shop business for the past eight years. He earns a monthly income of about KES 40,000 that he uses to take care of his family and pump back into the business.

He has been loaned KES 30,000 by KADET Ltd. He intends to use the loan to purchase more stock such as wheat flour, rice, maize, beans and peas in bulk.

He plans to use the anticipated profit to open another cereals shop.

In the future, he hopes to open a mill.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as wheat flour, rice, maize, beans and peas in bulk.

loans.name: Syano

texts.en:
Syano is a hardworking 28-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with two children. 

He has been engaged in farming for the last 11 years to provide for his family. Previously he used to sell second-hand clothes to make ends meet. 

He wants in the next five years to buy more land so that he can extend the area he cultivates and get more produce.

He is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES to buy seedlings and fertilizer. Thanks to the extension services of Faulu Kenya, he is now able to grow more produce on his farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. 

Thelma has a shop that sells snacks, beverages, & canned goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 16,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, & beverages. 

Thelma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Thelma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, & beverages

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 3 years and works hard to support her family. 

Lanie has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy materials for her tailoring business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Rosita has an eatery that serves various dishes. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making these dishes. 

Rosita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making dishes

loans.name: Joyner

texts.en:
Joyner is 30 years old. She is married and has 5 children between 13 and 5.

Joyner has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years in her home area of Eldoret in North Rift, Kenya. Her farm produces potatoes, vegetables, maize, and milk which she sells locally.  She also runs a retail shop business.

Joyner has made a loan request of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to fund the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow.  She is optimistic that her expanded business will uplift her family's living standards.  

Joyner aspires to grow her business into a wholesale one and own pedigreed dairy animals.   She however laments about the poor market prices for farm products.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Gemma has a shop that sells beverages, snacks, & canned goods. She has had this business for 17 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks. 

Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, & snacks

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Mrs. Roeun, age 50, has her own small farming business that she learned from her grandfather. Her main activity is planting a variety of crops and catching fish along the river for extra profit. The couple has lived together in a small house and are blessed with five single children. Three of the children make money in a variety of jobs. Mrs. Roeun will use her loan to purchase some fishing equipment such as a boat, machine and nets so she can catch more fish than the previous time. She resides in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: to buy a boat, machine and fishing nets

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is 56 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Constancia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Constancia requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her stall.

Constancia has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Constancia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn is a married woman with one child. She lives in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her family. 

Jeralyn is a farmer. She started growing rice three years ago. She sells her harvest at her town's market. Jeralyn earns about 4000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per month doing this farming. 

Jeralyn has requested a loan to purchase rice seed and fertilizers. She will also buy piglets to raise. Jeralyn hopes for her businesses to grow.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed, fertilizers, and piglets

loans.name: Camelo

texts.en:
Camelo is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has four children. 

Camelo is a fisherman and sells his catch in the market. He has had this business for 11 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy materials needed for the maintenance of his fishing net. 

Camelo has been a member of HSPFI since 2000. In the future, Camelo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the maintenance of his fishing net

loans.name: Burul's Group

texts.en: Two years ago Burul started to grow clover; she earns money by selling clover on the market. Burul is 26 and married to a taxi driver. Together with her husband, she is bringing up two children, both of whom are studying at school. At the moment she needs some money to purchase fuel and hire labor for collecting the harvest. For this purpose, she applied for this loan. With the profits gained from selling the harvest, Burul wants to purchase livestock for breeding and reselling. Burul is the leader of this group. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young and ambitious socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and hire labor for collecting the harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothing to resell.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi, 46, lives in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her family. 

She and her husband are both farmers. They work together in tilling their land and growing rice crops. Noemi also raises pigs to help augment their income. She works hard to support her family.

Noemi requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to open a sari-sari (variety) store business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 39 years old and married to Benter. They have four children.

He has been running his fish business for the past 10 years. He earns a monthly income of about KES 6,000 that he uses to take care of his family and pump back into his business.

He has been loaned KES 20,000 by KADET Ltd. He intends to use the loan to purchase more stock of fish for sale. He plans to use the anticipated profit to expand his business and educate his children.

In the future, he hopes to improve the living standards of his family by building a house and educating his children.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Rut

texts.en:
Rut is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is widowed, with 2 children.  Rut has a shop that sells fish. He has had this business for 5 years.

He requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell.  Rut has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rut hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Hayde

texts.en:
Hayde is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and other equipment.

Hayde has been in this business for 12 years. Hayde earns more income from food vending.

Hayde has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other equipment

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 3 children. Elvira has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 36 years old. He is a hardworking and determined businessman. He is married and blessed with 5 children, four of whom are in school.  For the last 18 years, he has been doing quarrying to provide for his family. Previously he used to sell second-hand clothes.  His dream is to have established a construction company in the next five years.

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a wheelbarrow, mattocks and mallet. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has developed a saving culture and gained business management skills.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrow, mattocks and mallet

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 31-year-old lady. She has given birth to five children: three of them are students while the other two are not of school-going age yet. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He sells fresh quality seasonal fruits through his shop which is near his home. 

Mumtaz has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah because her husband wants to improve his business. With this loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits that will allow him to offer his customers better quality fruit for more income. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years and Mumtaz is hopeful that an investment will result in good profits from his business and her family’s financial condition will get better. 

Mumtaz is a regular client of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In previous loan years, she has proven herself to be a responsible client by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting. In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Mumtaz.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits for selling.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 25 years old and single.  He raises poultry and has been in business for three and a half years.  Right now his monthly income from the business is KES.5,000.  He is requesting a loan of KES 8,000 to buy poultry feeds and medicine.

He plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to purchase more poultry for commercial purposes. This is his first loan.  His dream is to become one of the popular suppliers of poultry meat in Kenya.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds and poultry medication.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy palm nuts.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
This is Mirasol, 39, resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Domingo, a driver, and has two children.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mirasol is a fish vendor. She has a stall located in the community market.  She earns income by buying fish from the wholesaler and selling it per kilo in the community market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional fish stock to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mirasol hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of fish she needs for her store.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
 
Lourdes has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Lourdes has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lourdes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Nazima's Group

texts.en:
Nazima is the leader of this group. She is 34 and married to a builder. Together with her husband she is bringing up a boy and a girl. The daughter goes to school and the son is preschool age. 

Nazima works as a nurse in the hospital. Three years ago she got a loan in the amount of 7,000 KGS and with that money she bought a calf. Since that moment Nazima has been breeding cattle. With the profits gained from reselling cattle she repaired the house, improved the family’s living conditions and purchased a washing machine. 

She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds for purchasing more farm animals. In the future, Nazima wishes to purchase a vehicle for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase farm animals for breeding.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 36 years old he is married to Emily  who helps in supporting the family. His child is three years old.

He runs a dairy farming business and he has been in business for three years. Right now his monthly income from the business is KES 30,000.

He is borrowing a loan of KES 50,000 that he will use to purchase dairy cows for milk production and livestock for sale.

This is his second loan. He successfully paid his previous loan.

He hopes to continue with his dairy farming and to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mr. Keo is a 36-year-old married man who now lives in the Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Mr. Keo is a father of six children. Two of the children are married and live independently. One of the children assists his wife selling firewood. He is married to Ry, 33, who sells firewood in her community. They earn an income for their firewood business of about US $8 per day to use for their financial expenses. Mr. Keo will be using his loan to purchase planks and zinc to cover the roof of his house that has cracked down.

loans.use: to purchase planks and zinc to repair his roof

loans.name: 68 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Van is 41 years old and married. She has two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Van is the group leader of the 68 Thieu Do solidarity group, which consists of seven members.
 
Van has a retail business selling dry food. Van has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Van faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase household commodities to resell.

This is Van's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Van hopes to make enough money to provide for her children and for her family to be healthy and happy and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase household commodities to resell.

loans.name: Fils

texts.fr: Fils est un commerçant agriculteur, il est marié, il  a   25 ans et il a 1 enfant de 2 ans.il est ne au Rwanda .Il  a deux ans des études secondaires. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter un champ pour l'agriculture. Il  n’a aucune difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmenter les champs. Pour ses ambition il voudrait devenir le grand agriculteur en même temps un grand commerçant des semences dans son province, et il voudrait construire sa propre maison a usage résidentiel et payer le frais des études pour ses enfants .Il est aussi le chauffeur de taxi moto.
texts.en:
Fils is a farmer-merchant who is 25 years old and married. He has a 2-year-old child. He was born in Rwanda and has two years of secondary school education. This loan cycle is his third one with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy a field for growing crops. No difficulties are expected at all with regarding to repaying this loan. 

His strategy for business growth is to expand his fields. As his ambitions, he would like to become a major grower and a major merchant of seeds at the same time in his province. And he would like to build his own residential house and to cover the cost of his children's schooling. He is also a motorbike taxi driver.

loans.use: to use his loan to buy a farm field

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy palm nuts and maize.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred  is 44 years old. She is married to Stephen, and they are blessed with children.

She runs a poultry business in Tala town, whereby she sells chicken to the residents of that area, both female and male. Her customers buy poultry for keeping or eating. She has been doing this business for the last five years and gets an income of 5,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a client of KADET. She is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD, with which she plans to buy poultry. She will use the extra profit to buy goats and cattle.

She hopes to open a retail shop. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: to expand her business and add more poultry.

loans.name: Genalin

texts.en:
Genalin is 41 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Genalin works very hard to provide for them.

Genalin runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Genalin has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, seasonings, curls, and other groceries. 

In the future, Genalin would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking dishes.

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Mr. Than has been spending his life cultivating crops and some fruit on his own fertile land. He learned this skill from his parent when he was single. He is now married and has three school-aged kids. His wife works in the farm fields frequently alongside him. Growing crops is an annual action with which he has had great success. He is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for his crop. However, Mr. Than doesn’t have capital yet to use on his farm. So, Mr. Than is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting. With this loan, he will increase his net incomes by selling his crops when they are mature.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 52 years old and married with four children. Erma works very hard to provide for them.

Erma runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like noodles and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Erma has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, snack foods, etc. 

In the future, Erma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like noodles and groceries to sell

loans.name: Noussissi Group

texts.fr: Le groupement NOUSSISSI est formé de treize personnes qui se connaissent de part leur activité, fréquentent le même marché et qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin.  La représentante de ce groupement, nommée Delphine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Delphine est âgée de 53 ans, et vit au Bénin. Delphine est mariée à un électricien du nom de Vincent. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille,Delphine mène comme activité la vente de bijoux et de perles. Delphine s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Delphine et les autres membres du groupement NOUSSISSI sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en: The Noussissi group comprises 13 people who know each other through their businesses and attendance at the same market, and all live in the same area in Benin. The representative of the group, named Delphine, is the one with the raised hand in the photo. Delphine is 53 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to an electrician named Vincent. The couple have four children, all in school and still in the care of their parents. To provide for herself and her family, Delphine runs a business selling jewelry and pearls. She gets her supplies at one of the markets in Benin. This is the first time Delphine and the other members of the Noussissi group are seeking a loan with ALIDÉ. This loan will allow them to strengthen their businesses in order to better respond to the demands of their clientele.

loans.use: To buy pearls and jewelry.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 28 years old and single. She has been running her handbag business for the past one year. She earns a monthly income of about 6,000 Kenyan shillings, which she uses for her personal use and also pumps back into her business.

She has been loaned KES 10,000 by KADET LTD. This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She intends to use the loan to purchase more bags for sale and also expand her business.

She plans to use the anticipated profit to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to start her own boutique.

loans.use: to purchase more bags for sale and also expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize, ground nuts, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Joey

texts.en:
This is Ma. Joey, 36, resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo, and is the mother of two children. She, together with her husband and children, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Joey operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively separated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper, and other materials. They sell these to junk shops like Ma. Joey's for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP. She will be incorporating the loan with her current revolving funds used to buy trash from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ma. Joey dreams of being able to give all her children a high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a truck service for her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay back microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for scrap materials that she buys for her business.

loans.name: Mastula's Group

texts.en:
Mastula‘s group is comprised of two hard working women. Mastula is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has 1 child. Her child is currently in school.  Mastula has a small retail shop that sells sugar, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Mastula has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mastula hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child.  In the future, Mastula hopes to own a boutique that sells clothes. Mastula is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program which has helped her prospects for the future.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is a 29 year old Rwandan entrepreneur with 4 children between the ages of 3 and 9 years old.  All are in school. 

For the past 9 years, she and her and husband have run a business selling second hand shoes. 

Valentine will use the money from this loan to purchase more shoes so that she can increase her profits. She hopes to build up enough capital so that she can expand her business by selling a greater variety of goods in addition to  second hand shoes.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for sale

loans.name: Lonah

texts.en:
Lonah is a hardworking 38 year old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with 5 children. She has been operating a hotel for the last 2 years for the benefit of her family. In the next 5 years she wants to have a restaurant in more spacious premises.
Lonah is requesting a loan of 10000 Kenya shillings to buy beans, maize and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize and charcoal

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
