Roy‘s group is comprised of three hard-working women. Roy is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Roy has a business of tailoring, which she has had for 4 years.         

To help expand her business, Roy has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase materials for making clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Roy hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Roy hopes to expand her business and turn it in to a training center. Roy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making clothes for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose‘s group is comprised of three hardworking women. Rose is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children. All of her children are currently in school. Rose has a business of a small retail shop that sells sugar; she has had the shop for three years.         

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business. Rose is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fodder for the cattle.

loans.name: Mburucuja Group

texts.es:
Mburucuja se denomina el grupo de 11 mujeres de la ciudad de Pilar, ellas se juntaron gracias a que oyeron acerca del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, la idea las atrajo y decidieron unirse. Actualmente se encuentran en el tercer ciclo.
La Sra. Mariela, se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo, comenta que es muy buena cocinera y que a sus clientes les gusta mucho sus platillos. Ella se define como una buena cocinera, razón por la cual tiene muchos clientes que aprecian su buena comida. Ella sueña con algún día poder tener un pequeño bar donde vender sus comidas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos. Como ser carne, huevo, especias y demás.
texts.en:
'Mburucuja' is the name of this group of 11 women from the city of Pilar who came together because they had heard about the Entrepreneurial Women Program.  The idea attracted them and they decided to form a group.  They are currently on their third loan cycle

Mariela sells all kinds of food.  She tells us that she is a very good cook and that her customers really enjoy her meals.  She describes herself as a good cook which is why she has a lot of customers who appreciate her good food.  She dreams of some day being able to own a small bar where she can sell her meals.

Mariela is requesting a loan to buy the supplies she needs to make her food such as meat, eggs, spices and other products.

loans.use: to buy meat, eggs, spices and other products

loans.name: Marie Claire Gentille

texts.fr: Marie Claire Gentille est salarie, elle est célibataire, âgée de 23 ans, et elle est né au Rwanda.  .Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de secondaire et un an de l’université. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB.  Elle va acheter du ciment, peinture, planche et payer la main d’œuvre. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est  la construction d’une belle maison remplit des conditions exige par le plan directeur de sa district. Dans l’avenir il voudrait construire d’autre maison destine à la location, avoir une bonne famille
texts.en:
Marie Claire Gentille is employed and a 23 year-old single woman born in Rwanda. Her education consists of six years in secondary school and one year in college.
This is her first loan cycle with ABC. She will purchase cement, paint and boards, and pay for labor. Her strategy for the success of the project is to build a beautiful house fulfilling the conditions set by the master plan for her district.
In the future, she would like to build another house intended for rental and to have a good family.

loans.use: to buy  cement, paint, boards and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 35 years old and she is a hardworking and determined businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two children, aged 16 and 13. She has been selling clothing for the last four years to make ends meet and supplements her income from the earnings she gets by offering hairdressing services.

In the next five years, she wants to have expanded her business and bought a plot so that she can actualize her dream of owning rental houses.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy ladies and gents undergarments. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for advancing her loans to inject into her business.

loans.use: to buy ladies and gents undergarments.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. All of her children are currently in school. Aisha has had a business of selling milk for three years.         

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase milk for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Aisha hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Aisha hopes to expand her business.       

Aisha is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital.

loans.use: to purchase milk for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Batara

texts.en:
Batara is from the village Misaktsieli, East Georgia. He is 54 years old and lives with his wife Tina and three adult children.  He has two daughters who are 28 and 22 years old, and a son who is 27 years old. 

Batara and his wife earn a living with agricultural activities. In particular, they have five milk cows and eight calves. They sell dairy products at the local market. Also, the family owns a greenhouse with a total area of 600 sq. meters, where various vegetables are grown. Batara’s son works as a mechanical engineer in the village.  The total average monthly income of the family is 1600 Laris. 

With the requested loan Batara plans to construct a new cattle shed. He plans to increase the amount of cows in the farm, but doesn’t have enough space in the existing cattle shed building. He will purchase new cows as soon as the construction of the building is over. The income of the family will grow, which will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for a cattle shed

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is a 29-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives independently. He has owned an insurance office since 2009 and has more than five years of experience working in the same occupation. He deals with multiple insurance companies. He sells different types of insurance such as life, all risks, car, health insurance, etc. He has one part-time employee working as an outdoor sales agent under his supervision. 

Today, Houssam is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase insurance to sell. In the future, he is hoping to expand his business operation into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase insurance to sell.

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es: María Julia vive en casa alquilada con sus dos hijos  Edgar y Héctor que ya son mayores de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Empieza su día desde muy temprano para poder hacer todas las tareas de su hogar y luego continuar con su negocio. Se dedica a la venta de tortillas, ya tiene varios años de contar con esta pequeña tortillería y es la que le ha permitido sacar a sus hijos adelante. Gracias a Dios y a su esfuerzo ha logrado dar los estudios Universitarios a sus dos hijos y sigue trabajando para seguir cosechando los frutos de su trabajo. Ella quiere ampliar su tortillería, es decir, quiere aumentar la oferta de sus ricas tortillas para poder atraer a más clientes que le ayuden a mejorar sus ventas y por ende su situación económica. Esto la ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en los insumos necesarios como: maíz, agua, gas propano, etc. de esta manera espera lograr su sueño. Confía en Dios que esto le ayudará a mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
María Julia lives in a rental house with her two grown-up sons Edgar and Héctor.  She is an entrepreneurial and very hard-working woman.  She starts her day very early so that she can do all of her housework and then move on to working in her business.

María Julia sells tortillas.  She has owned a small tortilla bakery for several years and it has allowed her to get her children ahead in life.  Thanks to God and her efforts, she has managed to provide her two sons with a university education and she continues working so that she can continue reaping rewards from her work.  She would like to expand her tortilla bakery.  That is to say, she would like to increase her offer of delicious tortillas so that she can attract more customers which will help her to improve her sales and, thereby, her financial situation.

For this reason, María Julia has taken the decision to request a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in the supplies she needs such as corn, water, propane gas, etc. in order to achieve her dream.  She trusts in God that this will help her to improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy corn, water, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge  de 44 años vive en la ciudad de Cartagena, con su cónyuge y sus hijos en las edades de 10 a 18 años, allí mismo en la terraza de su casa se dedica a la venta de fritos y comidas rápidas en general, negocio que inició  con muchos sueños y donde es apoyado por su cónyuge, pues estàn de acuerdo en generar ingreso para generar ingresos a su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia. Su actividad la realiza  diariamente pero el mayor volumen de sus ventas las realiza los fines de semana, en su mayoría los productos se venden de contado, aunque una pequeña porción de estos lo hace a crédito.  Su sueño es tener una casa propia y expandir su negocio para sentirse cada día mas prósperos. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materias primas para la preparacion de alimentos y una carpa para proteger a su negocio y a su clientela  del candente sol y la lluvia al que ahora estàn expuestos porque su ubicaciòn al Norte del Caribe Colombiano, de sol playa brisa y mar asì lo exigen.
texts.en:
Jorge is 44 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena with his wife and children aged 10 to 18.  On the terrace outside his house, he sells fried food and fast food.  He started this business with a lot of dreams and is supported by his wife.  They are in agreement as to their need to make income for the household and to get their family ahead in life.

Jorge carries out his business every day but he makes most sales on weekends.  He sells most of his products for cash though he does sell a small portion on credit.  His dream is to own his own home and to expand his business so that he can continue feeling more prosperous.  This Kiva loan is Jorge's first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to buy raw materials for preparing his food, and an awning to protect his business and his customers from the burning sun and the rain that they are now exposed to owing to their location on the North Caribbean coast of Colombia complete with sun, beach, breeze and sea.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making food, and to buy an awning

loans.name: José Aníbal

texts.es: José Aníbal de treinta y nueve años de edad  vive en casa propia junto a su familia,  posee un negocio de venta de repuestos de bicicleta; es muy conocido en la localidad pues vende mercancía de muy buena calidad y a un buen precio  además  les ofrece un servicio muy especial trata de agradar a todo cliente que lo visita, José es un hombre emprendedor con ganas de salir adelante. Para él, solo una cosa vuelve posible un sueño y es el no tener miedo a fracasar es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar repuestos como llantas, cadenas, aceite, asientos, frenos entre otros; de esta forma tendrá satisfechos a sus clientes y es una buena manera de que su negocio crezca. José Aníbal tiene la confianza de que su arduo trabajo le permitirá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José Aníba is 39 years old and lives in his own home with his family. He owns a shop where he sells bicycle parts and is well known in his area since he sells high quality merchandise at a good price.  In addition he offers his clients a unique service and tries to please his customers. José is a hardworking man with a drive to succeed in life. For him, there only exists one thing that can make a dream come true and that is to not have any fear in failing. This is why he decided to request INTEGRAL a loan to buy tires, chains, oil, seats, brakes, etc. He will then be able to better satisfy his clients and this will be a way for his business to grow. José Aníbal has confidence in that his hard work will permit him to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy tires, chains, oil, seats, brakes, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedroras Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Mujeres Emprendedoras, se conformo con la iniciativa de la señora Eligia, gracias que oyó hablar del proyecto e investigo sobre el tema, y como le gustó mucho organizó a sus amigas y vecinas de la zona. Actualmente se encuentran  en el segundo ciclo, con diez integrantes. 
Culminaron el primer ciclo sin inconvenientes, han demostrado unión y solidaridad entre las compañera. Se definen como mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras.
La Sra. Zunilda es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de artículos. Gracias a este trabajo ella puede tener un poco mas de ingresos y de esa forma solventar los gastos de la casa. Ella comenta que tiene muchos clientes, puesto que posee todo tipo de productos. Le gustaría algún día poder ampliar su negocio para tener mas capacidad.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, cubiertos, ropas, y demás artículos para la posterior venta.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Entrepreneurial Women) committee was formed thanks to the initiative of Eligia who had heard about the project and decided to find out more.  As she really liked what she heard, she organized a group of friends and neighbors from her area.  The group is currently in its second loan cycle with ten members.  They completed their first loan cycle without any problems.  They have demonstrated mutual unity and solidarity.  The women describe themselves as very hard working and tenacious.

Zunilda is a saleswoman who sells all kinds of items.  Thanks to her work, she is able to make a little extra income and cover her household expenses.  She tells us that she has a lot of customers as she stocks all kinds of products.  She would like to be able to expand her business some day so that she has more capacity.

Zunilda is requesting this loan to buy sheets, covers, clothes and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy sheets, covers, clothes and other items

loans.name: Mario Oscar

texts.es: Mario Oscar  vive en casa alquilada junto a su esposa María y dos hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Mario es un hombre emprendedor y sobre todo trabajador. Se dedica a hacer publicidad móvil. Hace muchos años que empezó con este negocio y gracias a Dios los resultados han sido muy buenos. Él posee un carrito el cual usa para hacer su trabajo. Cuenta con muchos clientes fijos y lo prefieren por ser un hombre responsable, confiable y sobre todo por ofrecer calidad en su servicio. Quiere seguir manteniendo activo su negocio y seguir recibiendo los frutos D. mismo. Esto lo ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir especialmente en el mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que por el uso necesita de nuevos repuestos para que pueda seguir funcionando y además porque quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de su trabajo. Y de esta forma  espera mejorar su calidad de vida con los resultados D. mismo.
texts.en:
Mario Oscar lives in a rented house with his wife María and two children who go to school.

Mario is an enterprising and above all hardworking man. He works in mobile publicity. He began this business many years ago, and thanks to God he has gotten very good results. He has a car that he uses to do his work. Mario has many steady customers, and they prefer him because he is a responsible, trustworthy man and above all because he offers high-quality service.

He wants to keep his business active and continue reaping the fruits of his work. This has led him to ask INTEGRAL for this loan to invest especially in maintenance on his vehicle, since due to use it needs new spare parts so it will keep working and also because he wants to offer better quality in his work. And in this way he hopes to improve his quality of life with the profit from his work.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Amílcar

texts.es: Amílcar de 37 años de edad, habita en casa alquilada con su compañera de vida y su hijastro. Él se dedica a la venta de ropa. Hace varios años que posee el negocio y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien. Cuenta con muchos clientes ya que las personas lo prefieren por la calidad y variedad en sus productos y sobre todo por su carisma, siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y con mucha disposición. El sueña con ver su negocio florecer y poder satisfacer a más clientes que le permitan aumentar sus ventas y su nivel de ingresos. Esto lo ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar variedad de  prendas de vestir como: pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, etc. con esto espera lograr su sueño y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Amilcar (37 years old) lives in a rented house with his life partner and his stepson.

He sells clothing. He has had the business for many years, and thanks to God it has gone very well for him. He has many customers since people prefer him because of the quality and variety of his products, and above all because of his charisma. He always greets his customers with a smile and in a good mood.

He dreams of seeing his business flourish and of being able to satisfy more customers, which will allow him to increase his sales and his level of income. This has led him to ask INTEGRAL for this loan to buy a variety of clothing like: pants, shirts, underwear, etc. With this, he hopes to reach his dream and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add a stock of tomatoes, sacks of charcoal and potatoes

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha lives in Uganda.  She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (orphans).  

Aisha has a beauty salon business.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days out of every week.  Aisha sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale trade. Aisha has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves.  

The main business challenges for Aisha include seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal salon. Aisha lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rents, school fees and   feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more sugar, soap, cooking oil and other goods for his shop.

loans.name: Napoleon

texts.es: Napoleón vive con sus tres hijos  en una localidad muy concurrida; el elabora y vende dulces para feria. Napoleón tiene gran experiencia en su negocio y prepara dulces deliciosos y de buena calidad. Ya pronto se acercan las fiestas Agostinas en El Salvador y es una semana muy importante para la venta de Napoleón, siempre ha sido el número uno en las ventas de las ferias porque sus dulces son exquisitos y a precios accesibles, El quiere actuar como ganador es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima para la elaboración de los dulces como coco, tamarindo, miel, nances, leche, caramelo entre otros, de esta forma podrá satisfacer el gusto del cliente y al mismo tiempo llevara a su hogar el sustento para tener una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Napoleón lives with his three children in a very crowded area; he makes and sells sweets for fairs. Napoleón has a lot of experience in his business and makes delicious, high-quality sweets. Soon the Fiestas Agostinas (August festival) will be held in El Salvador, and it is a very important week for Napoleón's sales; he has always been number one in sales at the fairs because his sweets are luscious and reasonably priced.

He wants to act like a winner, and for this reason he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy raw materials to make his sweets, such as: coconut, tamarind, honey, nance fruits, milk and caramel among other items. In this way he will be able to satisfy his customers' preferences and at the same time support his household so they can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy coconut, tamarind, honey, nance fruit, milk and caramel.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 33 years old and supports three members of the family. He is to married to Ursler, who does some poultry farming to support the family. He has three children. He does a business of buying and selling milk to the co-operative society. He has been in business for six years; his monthly from the business is 255,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

He is borrowing a loan of KES 100,000 with which he plans to buy more liters of milk for sale. He plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to purchase a plot in Tuiyo Centre. This is his second loan, and he successfully paid his previous loan. His hopes and dreams are to buy a plot in Tuiyo Centre and construct rental houses.

loans.use: to buy milk from neighbors for sale to the co-operative society.

loans.name: Zakariah

texts.en: Zakariah is a 41-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three children. Two of the children are still attending school. He is an experienced furniture painter; He has been involved in this type of business for the past 23 years. Zakariah is a very talented man. He knows how to end up with original mixed colors. He is the main income provider of his family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional wood for his work. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Víctor Hugo

texts.es: Víctor Hugo de 46 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su esposa María de 32 años y su hijo que por el momento se encuentra estudiando. Víctor se dedica  a la venta de medicina natural en las principales zonas del lugar donde reside. Ha logrado establecer variedad de clientes gracias a su amabilidad y calidad de sus productos. Durarte muchos años ha trabajado duramente para poder llevar a su familia el pan de cada día. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y quiere mantenerlo activo por muchos años más. El desea poder ofrecer mayor variedad de medicinas a sus clientes para poder aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos. Es por esta razón que solicita este crédito para comprar variedad de medicinas como: vitaminas, pomadas, jarabes para la tos, y de más productos que sean atractivos para los clientes. Tiene plena confianza que los resultado van a ser positivos y podrá aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Víctor Hugo is 46 years old and lives in his own home with his wife, 32 year old María, and their son who attends school.   Víctor sells natural medicines in the main zones of the area where he lives.  He’s managed to establish many customers, thanks to his friendliness and to the quality of his products.  He’s worked hard for many years in order to provide his family with their daily bread.  This business is his primary source of income and he wants to continue it for many years to come.  He wants to be able to offer a greater variety of medicine to his customers so that he can increase his sales and income.  He is asking for this loan so that he can buy a greater variety of medicine, such as vitamins, creams, cough syrup, and more products that are attractive to his customers.  He is very confident that the results will be positive and he will be able to provide a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy medications for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock for his store.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Valientes, se conformó con la iniciativa de la señora Emilia. Este comité ha demostrado el buen trabajo en equipo y la solidaridad entre ellas. Están en el segundo ciclo mantienen las mismas integrantes las cuales expresan sus deseos de seguir con el compromiso y propósito de crecimiento económico y social del comité.
Ellas se definen como mujeres trabajadoras y sacrificada. Todas manifiestan estar muy a gusto dentro del programa.
La Sra. Alicia se dedica a la cría de animales. Desde pequeña se encargaba de los cuidados de los animales, ahora ese es su medio de subsistencia. Gracias e ese trabajo, ella puede generar un poco de ingresos que le es de mucha ayuda para solventar los gastos de la casa. Su sueño es tener una granja grande donde tener más animales que pueda criar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de más animales, y además alimentos para los demás. Está muy esperanzada en el crédito, ya que sabe que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Valientes was started by Emilia.  This group has demonstrated good teamwork and solidarity.  They are in their second cycle with the same members, who express their desire of continuing the commitment and the purpose of economic and social growth of the group. They define themselves as hardworking women who make sacrifices.  They all say they are very happy in the program.  

Alicia works raising animals.  Since she was young, she was in charge of caring for animals, and now it is her livelihood.  Thanks to this work, she is able to earn a little income, which helps her pay the household expenses.  Her dream is to have a large farm where she can have more animals to care for.

She is asking for this loan to purchase more animals and feed for them.  She is very hopeful about the loan, since she knows it will be a big help.

loans.use: to purchase animals and feed.

loans.name: Santos María Luz

texts.es: Santos María Luz de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo. Ella posee una tortillería y últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela, ahora su tortillería es la más visitada en la localidad pues las personas la prefieren porque tiene un buen servicio, es muy amable y rápida para despachar a los clientes, además que sus tortillas están  hechas de maíz de calidad y las vende a un buen precio. Santos María Luz quiere ver crecer su negocio y está haciendo su mejor esfuerzo para salir adelante, para ella lo más grande en el mundo es la mujer que lucha por un futuro mejor es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor para seguir elaborando tortillas y satisfacer a las personas que la visitan. Santos María Luz tiene fe que su esfuerzo le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos María Luz is 48 years old and lives with her life partner and their son. She has a tortilla business and lately she has gained many customers, so that her tortilla business is now the most-visited in her village. People prefer her business because she provides good service, is very friendly, and tends to her customers quickly. Furthermore, she makes her tortillas from good-quality corn and sells them at a good price.

Santos María Luz would like to see her business grow and is making her best effort to get herself ahead. To her, the greatest thing in the world is a woman who fights for a better future. This is why she has requested a loan through INTEGRAL. The loan will allow her to buy corn wholesale and to continue making tortillas to satisfy the people who visit her business. Santos María Luz has faith that her efforts will giver her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn in wholesale quantities

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. Sylvia lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.  

Sylvia has a business selling fruit and vegetables.  She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 6 days each week.  Sylvia sells her products at the wholesale market. Sylvia has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of passion fruit. Her goal for her business is to start buying passion fruit directly from farmers.

loans.use: to buy more bags of passion fruit.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 33 years old. He is married to Nancy who does some farming to earn additional income for the family. Their children are aged eleven years, eight years and four years. He has a business buying and selling milk. He has been in business for six years and his monthly income from the business is KES. 20,000.

Edwin is requesting a loan of KES. 50,000 which he will use to buy a cow for milk production. He plans to use the anticipated income from the business to buy another cow. This is his second loan and he successfully repaid his previous loan.

Edwin's dream and hope is to buy more dairy cows and to purchase a plot of land. He also wants to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 46-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two young children who are still attending school. He has owned a mini-market in his village since 2007. He sells all types of food products and drinks. His store is located in a crowded area so there are a good number of clients passing by his shop. Those customers ask for additional products, which don’t exist in Mohamad’s store. So today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his store’s inventory and therefore satisfy his customers' demands.  He has high hopes for the future of his business.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 56 years old. He is married to Mary, who assists her husband in farming to earn more income for the family. Their children are aged 25, 23, 21, 19, and 17 years. He has been in farming for 26 years; his monthly income from the business is KES. 20,000.

He is requesting a loan of KES. 20,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizer. He plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to complete construction of his rental houses.This is his second loan and he successfully repaid his previous loan.

His hope and dream is to complete his rental houses and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mburu

texts.en:
Mburu is 50 years old. He a farmer; he is married to Jacinta who is a housewife. They are blessed with ten children. He has been in the farming business for the past eleven years. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings and watering pipes. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children up to university level. His hope and dream is to export his farm produce which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and watering pipes.

loans.name: Jana

texts.en: Jana is a 49-year-old married woman living with her husband and two school-aged children. She is from Lebanon. She has 17 years of experience working in the food and beverage domain. In 2004, she decided to open her own mini-market where she started to sell dairy and daily products, juices, bread etc. She works hard in cooperation with her old husband who works in the agriculture field to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store’s inventory of food products and drinks. She is very positive and she’s confident that the loan will help her increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory of food products and drinks

loans.name: Gorett

texts.en:
Gorett lives in Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (one relative).

Gorett has a banana stall business. She has been in this business for five years, and she works six days out of every week.  Gorett sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale trade. Gorett has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. 

The main business challenges for Gorett include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to build her own house. Gorett lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rents, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Betty‘s group is comprised of four hardworking women. Betty is 22 years old and lives in the town of Bulengga in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Betty has a business of a poultry farm, which she has had for one year.  She also has a boutique that sells clothes as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase chicken and its feeds for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Betty hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself.  In the future, Betty hopes to own a supermarket. Betty is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving in her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken and its feeds for resale.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara lives in Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (orphans). 

Hajara has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Hajara sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale trade. Hajara has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. 

The main business challenges for Hajara include transportation and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van to ease transportation costs and also to educate her children up to university. Hajara lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the tea plantation.

loans.name: Mukene Women's Group

texts.en:
Nusula has been selling fish for the last decade in Lugazi. Nusula is 45 years old and she is a mother to six children. She says she joined this business with the persuasion of close friends. Before that, she was involved in a food sales business. The ten years have been years where she has not only learnt the fundamentals of doing business, but also learnt the ways and means of making it profitable and successful.

The fact that Lugazi is near Lake Victoria is an advantage in her business in that she does not have to spend much in transport costs. The fact that fish sells highly on the markets in Lugazi and the surrounding towns is also another merit. Her biggest challenge, however, is the tight competition manifest in this trade. In some seasons too, the fish stocks in the lake go scarce, meaning the fishermen will not make many a catch. This, needless to say, adversely affects her business.

Nusula says she makes sales profits totaling up to Ugandan shillings 30,000 on a weekly basis. With this Kiva loan, Nusula says she is going to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Ngugi

texts.en:
Ngugi is 29 years old and married with one child. He runs a barber shop so as to earn a living for his family. He has been operating his business for over five years. Besides this, he does dairy farming to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business and bought dairy cows.
Ngugi hopes to become financially stable in the future. He has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a shaving machine.

loans.use: to buy a shaving machine.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy lives in  Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. Cissy has a business of selling clothes. She has been in this business for one year. She works six days out of every week. Cissy sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Cissy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. The main business challenges for Cissy include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing clothes herself and to start selling on a wholesale basis only. Cissy lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 50 bags of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 45 years old and lives in Jacob town. She has two children age 5 and 14 years old. For the past six years, she has been operating a small shop where she sells drinks (soda, beer, energy drink etc), soap, and milk among other items. She is requesting a loan to purchase more drinks and other goods for her business. She hopes to buy a car in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks and other goods for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Wastaarabu Group

texts.en:
Saumu, who is in her late 30s is a widow with four children who go to school.  She has had two businesses selling cooked food and bed sheets from door to door since 2005. She works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start the bed sheets business, to increase her food business (which has expended tremendously) and for household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy madila (muslim type of dresses) and children clothes to sell during Ramadhan (the Muslim fasting period), which is coming next month. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Wastaarabu", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy madila (muslim type of dresses) and children clothes

loans.name: Makaba

texts.en: Makaba is 40 years old and lives in Jacob town. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have four children between the ages of 6 and 13 years old. All of them attend school. For the past seven years, she has been selling Lappa (traditional cloth) and drinks in her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase more Lappa and drinks to expand her business. She plans to build a house and buy land in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more Lappa and drinks to expand her business

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a 23-year-old farmer. She is married to John who is also a farmer. They are blessed with three children. She has been in farming with an income of KES 5,000, which she uses to support her family needs.
 
She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hope is to purchase a piece of land and construct rental houses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 64 years old. He supports a family of ten people. He is married to Jane, who helps him with the farm so as to get additional income for the family. His children are of the following ages: 23, 22, 20 ,18, 16, 14, 12, 10 and 8 years old. He practices farming and has been in business for 26 years. His monthly income from the business is 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Richard is borrowing 20,000 KES which he plans to use to buy seeds and fertilizer. He plans to use additional income to educate his children. This is his second loan and he successfully repaid his previous loan. His dreams and hopes are to continue with his farming and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy seed and  fertilizer.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother).

Sarah has a business of selling soft drinks. She has been in this business for five years and she works six days out of every week. Sarah sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Sarah has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of soda and mineral water. The main business challenges for Sarah include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to build her own house. 

Sarah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rents, school fees and  feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda and mineral water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 45-year-old farmer. He is a widower with four children who are 20, 17, 14 and 11 years old. He has been in the business for the past seven years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family needs.
 
He is applying for his fifth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children up to university level. His hope and dream is to export his farm produce, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 52 years old and married to Samuel.  She supports four members of the family. Her husband helps her in farming, hence increasing the income for the family. Her children are  15, 13, and 11 years old, respectively. .She does farming and she has been in business for 26 years. Her monthly income from the business is KES 5,000.

She is borrowing a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizer. She plans to pay school fees with the anticipated profit. This is her second loan and she successfully paid her previous loan.

Her dreams and hopes are to continue with her farming and to educate her grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy seeds and  fertilizer

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a 28-year-old enterprising businessman. He is married to Jane who is a housewife. They are blessed with two children. He has been running a green grocer business for the past year with a monthly income of KES 6,000, which he uses to support his family members.
 
He is applying for his first loan from KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to add a stock of kale, tomatoes and potatoes to his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hope is to expand his business and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To add kale, tomatoes and potatoes to his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more cakes and service his motorbike.

loans.name: Pyapy Mbareté Group

texts.es:
El comité Pyapy Mbareté nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo. Actualmente cuenta con 15 miembros, ellas fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, y más adelante conformar entre ellas mismas una Cooperativa.
La Sra. Anatolia tiene 55 años, ella esta domiciliada en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ella se define como una mujer emprendedora e innovadora. Ella se dedica al bordado desde hace ya muchos años, aprendió esta profesión gracias a su madre, por medio de este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante, tiene mucha demanda, lo cual le genera un dinero extra. Comenta que le gustaría que sus bordados sean vendidos por todo el país.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos, telas, agujas y demás, insumos necesarios para que ejerza su profesión. Ella da las gracias a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The Pyapy Mbareté group was born thanks to the management and support of another group working in the same area.  This group is from the city of San Lorenzo.  It currently has 15 members.  They set their main goal as the growth of each member, and later they formed a cooperative among themselves.

Anatolia is 55 years old and lives in the city of San Lorenzo.  She defines herself as an enterprising and innovative woman.  She has worked doing embroidery for many years.  She learned this profession thanks to her mother.  This work has allowed her to improve herself.  She has a lot of demand, which generates extra money.  She commented that she would like if her embroidery was sold all over the country.

She is asking for this loan to purchase thread, fabric, needles, and other necessary items to do her embroidery.  She would like to thank the foundation for the opportunity that they are giving her.

loans.use: to purchase thread, fabric, and needles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials to add to her stock.

loans.name: Royal Group

texts.en:
Pelegrin, who is in his early 60s, is married with 10 children and 8 grandchildren. Some of them go to school. He has a musical instruments studio, which he rents during celebrations e.g. weddings, send-off parties, etc. He has had this business for seven years now.  He normA. works at night from 8 p.m. up to the end of the function.

This will be his fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to service his music system for household expenses and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He hopes for a loan to buy new CDs, pins and cables to maintain the system for better performance. His dream is to have a very big and international studio.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Royal", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy new CDs, pins and cables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
Mabel tiene 34 años de edad. Vive con su esposo y 2 hijos en la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande en Piura. La comunidad, en la que Mabel vive, es de condición humilde pero con muchos deseos de superación.

Mabel se dedica a la crianza y venta de ovinos. Actualmente cuenta con 28 de estos que una vez que alcancen tamaño y peso ideal, los comercializará en el mercado local y a los pobladores de su caserío. Mabel también cría aves de corral, para su venta.

Mabel solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles para comprar el alimento balanceado que sus ovinos y aves requieren. Además, quiere realizar mejoras en el corral donde cría as sus animales para que estos tengan un mejor crecimiento.

Mabel es una clienta conocida de nuestra entidad, su primer crédito lo canceló puntual y responsablemente.
texts.en:
Mabel is 34 years old.  She lives with her husband and two children in the rural part of the Tambogrande district in Piura.  The community where Mabel lives is in humble condition but it has a great desire to improve.

Mabel works raising and selling sheep.  She currently has 28 sheep, and when they reach their ideal weight and size, she sells them in the local market and to the people in her town.  Mabel also raises poultry to sell.  

Mabel asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 nuevos soles to purchase the feed that her sheep and birds require.  She also wants to do some repairs in the corral where the animals stay so that they will have a better growth.

Mabel is a well known client of our bank.  She repaid her first loan punctually and responsibly.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mukisa Womens Group

texts.en:
Teddy has been operating her pub business for a decade now in a town known as Lugazi, which is situated in central Uganda. The town is famous for its sugar-making factories that supply Uganda's sugar. This town has been attracting laborers from all over Uganda. Most of these people are eagerly searching for means of survival. Lugazi has of late become quite a melting pot of all tribes from Uganda and for people of all persuasions. This influx of people has brought with it opportunities for many of Lugazi's indigenous people.

One person who rose to the occasion after sensing a great business opportunity is 40-year-old Teddy, a happy-go-lucky and humorous divorced woman who unfortunately, does not have any kids yet.

At her pub, her clients can stand a treat of great delicacies on top of the hard and soft beverages that she has on offer. She offers all sorts of non-alcoholic and alcoholic beverages. On the side, Teddy has a farming business that she plies.

This business generates for Teddy 100,000 Ugandan shillings on a weekly basis as gross profits. The purpose of this Kiva loan, Teddy says, is to help her purchase more crates of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: And Soukali Jeeguene Pire 3 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).
texts.en:
This is a group composed of five members who live in the village of Pire, 100 km from DAKAR, the capital of Senegal. Their main work involves commerce in farm products and cassava root. The group members are experienced in this domain and have a good customer base. The workday starts at 8:00 in the morning and ends around 8:00 at night. 

With this financing, the group members intend to buy 100 sacks of cassava that they are going to resell at the market. The revenues derived from the sale of cassava will enable them to bolster their business but also to satisfy the needs of their children (payment of school and medical fees and maintaining the house).

loans.use: to buy cassava, peanuts, and millet

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora tiene 64 años D. edad, es madre D. 2 niños y vive en el distrito D. Oyotún en Chiclayo. Oyotun es un distrito rural donD. las principales actividades son la ganadería y agricultura, sus pobladores son personas pujantes y trabajadoras.

Dora posee una pequeña bodega en la que venD. golosinas y bebidas. Además se dedica a la venta D. flores en las afueras del cementerio D. su localidad. Dora  cuenta con clientela establecida, y es una mujer D. buenas referencias personales, tiene más D. 10 años D. experiencia en ambos negocios.

Ella solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra D. mercadería para su bodega y su puesto D. flores. Además parte del préstamo será utilizado en mejorar el interior D. su casa y en gastos personales que le son D. suma necesidad.
texts.en:
Dora is 64 years old.  She is the mother of 2 children and lives in the Oyotún district in Chiclayo.  Oyotun is a rural district where the main activities are agriculture and raising livestock.  

Dora has a small store where she sells candy and beverages.  In addition, she sells flowers outsiD. the town cemetery.  Dora has an established customer base and good personal references.  She has been working in both businesses for more than 10 years.  

She is requesting a loan for 2000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] through Edpyme Alternativa that she will use to buy merchandise for her store and a flower stand.  Additionally, part of the loan will be used to make improvements to the interior of her house and for her most pressing personal expenses.

loans.use: purchase merchandise for her store and a flower stand as well as for home improvements and personal expenses.

loans.name: Range Group

texts.en:
Luci, who is in her early 20s, is married with one baby. She has had a charcoal business for one month now. She works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to buy more sacks of charcoal. Her dream is to one day be able to buy land.

Luci will share this loan with her loan group "Range" which has a total of 16 members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 44 años de edad, vive con sus 3 hijos en una comunidad pequeña y rural del distrito de Tambogrande, en Piura.

Esther se dedica a la crianza y  venta de ganado ovino. Actualmente cuenta con 20 animales. Ella tiene 7 años de experiencia en su negocio, lo que le ha permitido ganar una clientela fija, a pesar de la gran competencia con la que cuenta.

Esther solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado a sus ovejas y hacer mejoras en el corral donde las cría. Esto le permitirá mejorar su negocio, pues sus ovinos tendrán una mejor crianza y los podrá vender a mejores precios.

Esther es una clienta conocida de nuestra entidad y goza de buenas referencias crediticias.
texts.en:
Esther is 44 years old and lives with her 3 children in a small, rural community in the Tambogrande district in Piura.  

Esther raises and sells sheep for a living.  Currently, she has 20 animals.  Her 7 years of experience in this business has allowed her to earn a steady clientele in spite of the enormous competition.  

Esther is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternativa to purchase balanced feed for her sheep and to make improvements to the pen where she raises them.  This will allow her to improve her business as she will be able to better raise her sheep and sell them for better prices. 

Esther is a returning customer to our institution and enjoys good credit references.

loans.use: purchase balanced feed for her sheep and improve their pen.

loans.name: Marnelia

texts.es:
Marnelia tiene 49 años de edad, es una madre soltera que vive desde hace 10 años en una zona urbana en vías de desarrollo, perteneciente al distrito de Pacanga en Chepén- La Libertad.

Marnelia se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, como hierbas medicinales, en un pequeño puesto ubicado en las afueras del mercado de su localidad, tiene muchos años de experiencia en el negocio lo que la han llevado a contar con clientela establecida y con un buen desarrollo de su actividad.

Marnelia solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para acondicionar su puesto de trabajo. Ella desea comprar una mesa más grande que le permita exhibir sus productos con mayor facilidad. Además, utilizará otra parte del crédito en la compra de mercadería  y en gastos personales.

Marnelia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales. Ella tiene muchos deseos de prosperar en su negocio para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marnelia is 49 years old. She is a single mother who has lived for 10 years in an urban zone which is still developing, in the district of Pacanga in Chepén- La Libertad.

Marnelia works selling natural medicines, such as medicinal herbs, from a small stand located on the edge of the market in her area. She has many years of experience with this work, and thanks to this she has built up an established customer base and a good level of development for her business. 

Marnelia is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 Peruvian new soles to fix up her sales stand. She would like to buy a larger table which will allow her to exhibit her products more effectively. In addition, she will use another part of the loan to buy merchandise, and also to pay some personal expenses.

Marnelia is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has excellent personal and work references. She has a great desire to prosper in her business so she can provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to improve her sales stand, buy merchandise and pay some personal expenses.

loans.name: Ivane

texts.en:
Ivane comes from the village of Kistauri, East Georgia. He is 53 years old, married and lives in the village with his family: wife Natalia, two daughters (14 and 11 years old) and parents, who are retired. Ivane’s daughters go to school. 

Ivane is a farmer. His main source of family income is a beekeeping business. He owns 60 beehives and gets the honey twice a year. He sells it on the local market. Along with beekeeping, Ivane is also busy with corn growing. The corn is also sold on the local market. 

He requests credit for purchasing fertilizers for the cornfield. After fertilizing, Ivane will get a better quality harvest and will sell that harvest for a good price on the market. He plans to reinvest the increase in income in the family farm in order to make it more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for the cornfield.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martín tiene 36 años de edad, vive con sus 2 hijos en una comunidad en vías de desarrollo perteneciente al distrito de Morropón en Piura.

Martín se dedica a la dirección de obras de construcción, es albañil desde hace 10 años y cuenta  con gran experiencia en su rubro, lo que le ha permitido tener clientela establecida en la zona.

Martín solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles  para comprar herramientas, como tablas andamios, que le permitan continuar con el óptimo desarrollo de su trabajo. Martín, además, necesita el préstamo para adquirir bienes de uso personal que le son de suma necesidad.

Martín es un hombre trabajador que tiene muchos deseos de superación, pues quiere darles la mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martínis 36 years old and lives with his 2 children in a developing community in the Morropón district in Piura. 

Martín works in construction management.  He has been a mason for 10 years and has a lot of experience in his profession which has allowed him to build an established clientele in his area.  

Martín is requesting a loan for 3000 nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternativa to buy tools such as scaffolding that will allow him to continue developing in his trade.

Martín is a hard-working man that wants to excel as he wants to give his children the best quality of life.

loans.use: purchase tools for his job.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 50 años de edad y vive con su hijo en una comunidad urbana pequeña, humilde y en vías de desarrollo perteneciente al distrito de Castilla en Piura. Los pobladores de esta comunidad son principalmente comerciantes minoristas.

Consuelo se dedica a la venta de ropa y moños hechos a base de junco (ramas de plantas secas). Ella cuenta con clientela establecida en la zona ya que viene realizando esta actividad desde hace 8 años y conoce el rubro a la perfección.

Consuelo solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un  préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para comprar prendas de vestir y junco (para realizar moños) que le permitan abastecer los pedidos con los que cuenta.

El negocio de Consuelo  se está desarrollando cada vez más  y ella espera seguir aumentando su demanda para tener mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 50 years old and lives with her son in a small, modest, developing, urban community in the Castilla district in Piura.  

Consuelo sells clothing and bows made from reeds (dried plant branches).  She has an established customer base in her area as she has had this business for 8 years and knows the trade perfectly.  

Consuelo is requesting a loan for 800 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] through Edpyme Alternativa to buy clothing and reeds (to make her bows).  This will allow her to fill her existing orders.  

Consuelo's business is growing and she hopes to continue increasing demand so she can increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase clothing and reeds to make bows.

loans.name: And Soukali Jeeguene Pire 4 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).
texts.en:
This is a group composed of five members who live in the village of Pire, 100 km from DAKAR, the capital of Senegal. Their main work involves commerce in farm products and cassava root. The group members are experienced in this domain and have a good customer base. The workday starts at 8:00 in the morning and ends around 8:00 at night. 

With this financing, the group members intend to buy 100 sacks of cassava that they are going to resell at the market. The revenues derived from the sale of cassava will enable them to bolster their business but also to satisfy the needs of their children (payment of school and medical fees and maintaining the house).

loans.use: to buy cassava, peanuts, and millet

loans.name: Aravoi Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la cuidad de Caacupé. Ellas se unieron con el objetivo de generar más ingresos y de esa forma poder brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Ellas son mujeres luchadoras y muy sacrificadas. Comentan que no se cansan de trabajar, pues esa es la única forma en la que podrán cumplir el objetivo que se propusieron.
La señora Vilia está casada, vive con su marido y sus hijos, ella trabaja en la cría y posterior venta de cerdos y pollos, por medio de este trabajo ella ayuda en los gastos de la casa a su marido, para que esa forma el gasto sea compartido. Ella desea, algún día, poder tener una granja donde pueda albergar a más animales y de esa forma ampliar su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos y pollos, con esto podrá tener más animales, lo cual le ayudará a generar más ingresos con la venta de los mismos.
texts.en:
The women of the present committee are from the city of Caacupe. They meet together with the object of generating more income and in this form, offering a better future to their children. They are very sacrificing, combative women.

Mrs. Vilia is married, and lives with her husband and their children. She works at raising and later, selling pigs and chickens. With the work, she helps pay household expenses, aiding her husband in this way, so that the burden will be shared. Vilia wishes some day to have a farm where she can accommodate her livestock and in this manner, expand her business.

Vilia is requesting a loan to buy pigs and chickens, so she can have more animals, and generate more income with their sale.

loans.use: compra de cerdos y pollos para la cría y posterior venta

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock more chicken feed as well as buying day-old chicks for business expansion.

loans.name: Edwin Ivan

texts.es:
Iván es un joven emprendedor de 23 años de edad. Es padre de un niño y vive en  una comunidad pequeña en vías de desarrollo en el distrito de La Matanza en Morropón.

Iván se dedica a preparar el terreno para la siembra de productos agrícolas, este servicio lo brinda desde hace 3 años, y es un servicio muy requerido en la zona donde vive. Iván cuenta con clientes establecidos.

Iván solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar herramientas modernas, para preparación de tierras de cultivo y darle mantenimiento a las que tiene, y así poder desarrollar su trabajo de una manera óptima.

Iván tiene muchos deseos de superación y desea seguir creciendo en su actividad para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Este crédito le permitirá continuar el buen desarrollo de su labor.
texts.en:
Ivan, an enterprising young man, is 23 and the father of a young child.  He lives in a small rural community in the La Matanza district of Morropon.

Ivan makes a living preparing land for planting.  It's a necessary step for farmers in this region and Ivan has been doing it for 3 years.  He has a regular set of customers for the service.

Ivan is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new soles loan that he will use to buy the modern tools he needs for the business and to maintain the tools he has.  The investment will lift the business.

Ivan is ambitious and wants to grow the business so that he can improve the lives of his family.  This loan will allow him to go on working and developing the business.

loans.use: to buy new tools for his farm-service business.

loans.name: Malila Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her early 50s, is married with four grown-up children and two grandchildren who go to school.  She has been selling fabrics, bed sheets and children's clothes, which she sells from door to door, for one year now. She works from 9.30 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able make a small monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her clothing business and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy more fabrics, bed sheets and children's clothes to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to buy land.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Malila", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics, bed sheets and children's clothes to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cassava, millet and peanuts

loans.name: Carlos' Group

texts.en: Carlos, Milton, and Byron are the members of Carlos’ Group. The group lives near the city of San Gabriel, Ecuador. Carlos, the group’s president, is 28 years old and single. He lives with his mother and does not yet have children. He is a person with a great capacity to move forward with his life. He is not frightened by struggling to achieve what he sets out to achieve each day. Carlos works toward his goals with great enthusiasm. Carlos is a farmer who concentrates on growing potatoes. He is seeking this loan to continue with his business and to ensure that he does not lose his harvest. He has worked with micro loans from FODEMI for two years and says that FODEMI has opened many doors for him. Carlos finds that microloans have helped him support the pursuit of his dreams. He hopes that this loan will help his business grow more each day and help fulfill his dreams to get ahead. He wants to give his family a better life and support his future children. Carlos’ dream is to buy a new estate farm and continue to constantly fight for increased well-being and a better quality of life in the future.

loans.use: to care for his potato crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a variety of clothes especially baby clothes.

loans.name: Manuel Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 38 años de edad, es padre de 2 niños y vive en casa familiar en la parte rural del distrito de San José  en  Pacasmayo – La Libertad. Es un hombre trabajador que goza de buenas referencias personales.

Manuel se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, desde hace 10 años. Cuenta con gran experiencia y eso hace que sus animales tengan una buena crianza. Es por ello que Manuel cuenta con clientela establecida en la zona, que se encuentra más que satisfecha con el producto obtenido. 

Manuel solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar animales y el alimento balanceado que requieren. Esto le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.

Manuel ya ha trabajado con nuestra entidad y ha sido puntual en sus pagos
texts.en:
Manuel, 38, has 2 children and lives in the family home in the San Jose district of Pacasmayo-La Libertad.  He's a hard-working man with good references.

Manuel has made a living raising and selling animals for 10 years.  He knows the business well and takes good care of his animals.  His regular customers know his reputation and are more than happy to buy from him.  

Manuel is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new soles loan that he will use to buy animals and the feed that he needs to care for them.  The loan will allow him to continue growing his business and, in turn, improve his quality of life.  

Manuel has worked with us before and has been punctual about repaying his loans.

loans.use: to buy animals and supplies for his animal-sales business.

loans.name: Odalia Del Carmen

texts.es: Odalia tiene su negocio que es la venta de ropa nueva. Desde hace 7 años trabaja en esta actividad, sale a vender sus productos a diferentes clientes que tiene y que le solicitan una gran variedad de productos. Así se genera las ganancias y busca como proporcionarles a sus 3 hijos el pan de cada día. En esta ocasión el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y trajes.
texts.en: Odalia has owned a clothing sales business for 7 years.  She sells her merchandise to her regular customers and they want a wide range of clothing to choose from.  The business is Odalia's main source of income and her means of providing her 3 children with their daily bread.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise for her business: shirts, trousers, skirts, dresses and suits.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es: José Ricardo de sesenta y uno  años de edad vive con su compañera de vida. El posee una tienda la cual surte con productos de primera necesidad, es muy visitada por las personas del lugar pues siempre encuentran lo que necesitan,  por supuesto de buena calidad y a un  buen precio, Don José Ricardo es un hombre trabajador muy activo, siempre está a la vanguardia y le gusta encabezar  a la competencia; quiere llegar a la cima y está dispuesto a esforzarse duro para lograrlo es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, azúcar, golosinas, pan, bebidas entre otros, así mantendrá su negocio a flote y logrará darle a su familia estabilidad económica.
texts.en: José Ricardo is 61 years old and lives with his life’s partner.  He has a store where he sells basic need products.  The store is well visited by people and they always find what they need, and of course it’s of good quality and price.  José Ricardo is a hard working active man who is always alert and likes to lead the competition.  He wants to be on top and is prepared to work hard to get there.  It’s for this reason that he is requesting this loan through INTEGRAL.  It will allow him to buy basic grains, sugar, snacks, bread, and drinks among other things.  In this way he will maintain his business afloat and will succeed in giving his family financial stability.

loans.use: to buy inventory items.

loans.name: And Soukali Jeeguene Pire6 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).
texts.en: This group is composed of 5 members who live in the village of Pire, 100 kilometers from DAKAR, the capital of Senegal.  Their main business is selling agricultural products, such as manioc tubers.  They are experienced in this field and have a strong client base.  Their days begin at 8 a.m. and end around 8 p.m.  With this funding, they plan to buy 100 bags of manioc that they will resell at the market.   The income earned from the sale of manioc will enable them to expand their business and to take care of their children’s needs (payment of school fees and medical expenses and helping with home maintenance).

loans.use: To buy manioc, ground nuts and millet

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 42 años y tiene cinco hijos de las cuales dos son independiente y tres todavía están a su lado.     Ella es una persona responsable, amable y trabajadora y por esas cualidades le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Nueva Luz de Echarate” de la Asociación Arariwa. Marcelina nació en el distrito de Chinchero (Urubamba, Cusco). Actualmente, Marcelina vive en la ciudad de Echarate y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. 

Marcelina por las mañanas vende refrigerios en el colegio Nacional José María Arguedas, ella alquila el stand  a S/. 2,50 diarios y trabaja desde el mes de marzo de este año.  Pero el negocio del colegio está paralizado por qué están haciendo mantenimiento de los puestos de venta. En esta oportunidad Marcelina requiere el préstamo para comprar sillas, mesas y cubiertos para implementar el puesto de venta del colegio. Marcelina por las tardes se dedica a la venta bebidas heladas (Gaseosas, Cerveza) en su domicilio. 

La ciudad de Echarate es la ciudad capital del distrito de Echarate de la Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 42 years old.  She has five children, two of whom are independent and three of whom are still at her side.  She is a responsible person, kind and hardworking, and because of these qualities she was invited to participate in the communal bank “Nueva Luz de Echarate” ("New Light of Echarate"), part of Arariwa Association.  

Marcelina was born in the district of Chinchero (Urubamba, Cusco).  At present, Marcelina lives in the city of Echarate and this is where she carries out her work activities.

Marcelina sells refreshments in the morning at the Nacional José Maria Arguedas college.  She rents the stand for 2.50 New Soles per day, and has been working there since March of this year.  But the business at the school is paralyzed because they are doing maintenance on the sales area.  Marcelina is requesting the loan for this opportunity to buy chairs, tables and cutlery to create a sales area at the school.  In the afternoons, Marcelina works selling cold drinks (sodas, beer) from her home.

Echarate City is the capital city of Echarate District, in the Province of La Convención.  It is an important trading center for the valleys of Lares and a Convención.  Its main activities are the production of coca, coffee, cocoa and fruit.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables and cutlery.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, ao sul de Mocambique casado e pai de 2 filhos de 12 e 18 anos de idade tdos vão a Escola.Fez a 5ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta uma irmã que vive com ele.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, trabalha como motorista permanente que trabalha apenas 3 dias por semana e é dono de um negocio de criação de frangos de corte ha 4 anos onde consegue um rendimento mensal de 8.400.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
