Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos.Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem são clientes e este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (pintos, vitaminas, ração, e outros). 
Sonha em ampliar o seu negocio e abrir uma oficina de bate chapa, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in the southern part of Mozambique.  He is married and the father to two children who are 12 and 18-years-old.  Both go to school.  He completed five years of schooling but stopped because of a lack of money.  He lives in his own house with his family and maintains a sister who lives with him.  He has never left Maputo.  He works as a driver, only working three days a week and is the owner of a business that raises chickens which he has had for four years and which brings in a monthly income of 8.400 meticais (Mozambique currency) which he uses for household expenses and saves some for his bank account (World Bank).

He has never taken out loans with other banks.  He heard about Hluvuku through friends who also are customers and this is his first loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 25,000 meticais which he plans to use to buy products like chicks, vitamins, feed, and others).  

He dreams of expanding his business and opening an office for car bodywork.  To do do this he intends to request more Hluvuku loans.

loans.use: to raise poultry (chickens, vitamins, feed, among other things).

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la cuidad de Caacupé. Se forma gracias a la iniciativa de una de las señoras que escucho hablar del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, y como le gustó mucho, decidió comentárselo a sus amigas y vecinas, es de ahí que deciden formarse y organizarse. Las Señoras son mujeres muy sacrificadas, en su mayoría cabeza de familia. Actualmente cuenta con 12 miembros y están en el 4 ciclo.
La Sra. Epifania vive con su marido e hijos, ella se dedica a la artesanía, así logra ayudar para el sustento de su familia. Ella comenta que esta muy orgullosa de lo que hace por que mediante su trabajo no solo genera ingresos para ayudar en la casa sino también promueve la artesanías paraguayas. Su sueño es tener una galería donde exhibir sus artesanías.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, colorantes y demás insumos para la elaboración de sus artesanías. Está con las esperanzas puestas en el crédito ya que sabe que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The women of the present committee are from the city of Caacupe. They formed at the initiative of one of their own who heard about the program for enterprising women, and since she liked the idea very much, decided to tell her friends and neighbors. As a result, they decided to get together and organize. They are very sacrificing women, in their majority heads of families. At present, there are 12 members and they are in their 4th loan cycle.

Mrs. Epifania lives with her husband and children. She is an artisan who by means of her work, is able to help sustain her family. Epifania says that she is very proud of what she is able to do through her efforts, not only generating income to help with household expenses but also, promoting Paraguayan artisan crafts. Her dream is to have a gallery where she can exhibit her artisan work.

Epifania is requesting a loan to buy cloth, thread, coloring and other supplies for the elaboration of her artisan crafts. She has her heart set on the loan, since she knows it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: buy cloth, paint, thread and other supplies to elaborate artisan crafts.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA  SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Yungaqui, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; la socia tiene 32 años de edad; la socia es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, de 14, 12, 8, 7 meses de edad; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores y ganados vacunos; La socia tiene toros y vacas, la socia compra ganados y los engorda y vende, ahora ella desea comprar una vaca ternera; la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una vaca ternera. 

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Communal Bank "TAYTACHA MAN OF CCOYLLORITY OF YUNGAQUI." The bank belongs to the Yungaqui district, Anta Province, and Cusco department.

The member is Mrs. Elizabeth who is 32 years old, has a partner and has 4 children who are 14, 12, 8, and 7 months of age. She buys and sells small animals and cattle. She owns bulls and cows. She buys livestock then fattens them up and sells them. At the moment she wants to use the loan to buy a calf.

She is very satisfied and thankful for the support being offered through this medium and commits to fulfill the payments in the established time period.

loans.use: invest in a calf.

loans.name: Ananias

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, provincia de Maputo, ao sul de Mocambique casado e pai de 1 filho de 2 anos de idade.Fez a 11ª classe e continua a estudar. vive na casa cedida pela Maê com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe que vive com ele.
Nunca saiu de Boane, trabalha como professor a 2 anos e tem um rendimento mensal de 4.128.30mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos.Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de familiares que tambem são clientes e este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para a sua obra (pedra, areia, cimento,ferro, e outros). 
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem dificuldades e sonha em concluir a sua casa, mobiliar para oferecer melhor conforto a sua familia, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the Boane district in Maputo province in the south of Mozambique.  He is married and has one sone who is two-years-old.  He finished 11 years of schooling and continues to study.  He lives in a house given to him by his mother who lives with him.  He has never left Boane.  He has worked as a teacher  for two years and has a monthly salary of 4,128.30 metiais (Mozambique currency) which he uses for household expenses and saves some for his bank account.

He never would take out the loan with other banks.  He heard about Hluvuku through relatives who are also customers and this is his first loan in Hluvuku in the amount of 20,000 meticais.  He plans to use it to buy construction materials for his house project (stone, sand, cement, iron among others.  He is confident that he will be able to make the payments without difficulties and dreams of finishing his house and moving in to offer better comfort to his family and so that he can take out more loans with Hlvuku.

loans.use: to buy materials for his house project (stone, sand, cement, iron, and others).

loans.name: Yesenia Elizabeth

texts.es: Yesenia Elizabeth D. 28 años D. edad, habita en su casa con su madre, 4 hijos y 3 sobrinos. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y sobre todo emprendedora que ha trabajado durante mucho tiempo para sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee un pequeño comedor en el cual venD. rica comida y bebidas. Su negocio está ubicado en una zona muy estratégica y muy concurrida por los habitantes del lugar. Muchas personas prefieren los ricos platillos D. Yesenia ya que para ella lo más importante son sus clientes y siempre los atienD. con una sonrisa. Su sueño es aumentar la variedad D. platillos que ofrece para poder atraer a más clientes que le permitan aumentar su nivel D. ingresos. Para esto necesita invertir para comprar la materia prima necesaria para la elaboración D. los deliciosos platillos. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar los insumos necesarios como: verduras, carnes, pollos, bebidas, etc. Que le permitan elabora variedad D. platillos con el objetivo D. atraer a más clientes que le permitan aumentar sus ventas y por enD. su nivel D. ingresos.
texts.en: Yesenia Elizabeth is 28 years old and lives with his mother, four children, and three nephews.  She’s a hardworking and above all very enterprising woman who’s worked long to get her family ahead.  She has a small restaurant where she sells delicious food and drinks.  Her business is located in a very strategic zone, well known to its residents.  Many people prefer Yesenia’s dishes because her customers are the most important thing to her and she always serves them with a smile.  Her hope is to increase the variety of dishes she offers in order to attract more customers and increase her income levels.  To do this, she needs to buy ingredients to make her delicious dishes, so she has seen fit to request a loan through INTEGRAL.  She will use the money to buy things like vegetables, meats, poultry, drinks, etc., that will allow her to make her dishes and attract more customers, and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Nicolás oriundo de valle grande, vive con la Sra. Yanet y tienen un hijo, su domicilio es alquilado vive en la zona el torno, es de ocupación moto taxista, trabaja en el torno, hace unos tres años se dedica a esta labor, donde le va muy bien con esta actividad mantiene a su familia, ahora su esposa esta queriendo incursionar en la venta de ropa, así de esta manera poder colaborar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, por este motivo solicito el crédito  para compra de mercadería para que venda su esposa, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: Nicolás is a native of the grand valley and lives with Yanet and their son in a rented home.  He lives in the Torno zone and drives a moto-taxi.  He works in El Torno and has been doing this for about three years.  Things are going well for him and he supports his family.  Now his wife wants to begin selling clothing so that she can also contribute to the household expenses.  He is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise that his wife can sell.  He is grateful to the institution for the support given him.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is from the village of Koghoto, East Georgia. She is 59 years old. Mariam lives with her husband Otar and five children: three daughters (25, 24 and 22 years old) and two sons (20 and 21 years old).

Mariam has a small grocery store. She sells various grocery products. In addition, the family owns three milk cows. She uses milk for cheese and yogurt production, which are sold in her store. The average monthly income of the family is 1,200 Laris. It is enough only to cover the family's daily essential expenses. 

Mariam requested a loan for renovation of the kitchen, as it is in bad condition. After she pays back this loan, she plans to start renovation of other parts of the house in order to improve the living conditions for her big family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for kitchen renovation

loans.name: Canisia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Yungaqui, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Canisia; la socia tiene 48 años; la socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, de 12, 9, 7 años de edad;  La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores, la socia cría cuyes, chanchos, ovejas, gallinas, la socia vende en la tablada los días de feria que son los sábados y domingos, la socia desea comprar 2 vacas terneras para aumentar sus ganados, la socia los cría engorda produce leche las vacas ella tiene la posibilidad de vender leche fresca y producir quesos y luego vender las vacas maduras o vender como carne, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de 2 vacas tiernas.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Community Bank  “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”.  The bank is in Yungaqui district, in the province of Anta, and department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Canisia, and she is 48 years old.  The member lives with her partner and has 3 children, aged 12, 9, and 7 years old.  The member works buying and selling small animals; the member raises guinea pigs, pigs, sheep, and chickens.  The member sells in La Tablada, where market days are Saturdays and Sundays.

The member wants to buy two calves to increase her herds.  The member will raise them and fatten them to produce milk.  She has the possibility to sell fresh milk and make cheese, and then later sell the mature cows or sell them as meat.  The member is applying for the loan to invest in the purchase of two young cows.

The member is very satisfied and grateful for the support that is provided through this medium and agrees to comply with her repayments within the prescribed period.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of two young cows.

loans.name: Iringa Group

texts.en: Benito, who is in his late 40s, is married with one child who goes to school. He has been running a poultry business for one year now. He works from 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be his third motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. He used the previous loans to buy chicken feeds and medicine and has paid back all his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to buy more chicks and chicken feeds. His dream is to one day be able to buy a land. He will share this loan with his loan group "Iringa," which has a total of eight members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase bundles of second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea  D. 27 años D. edad, habita en casa propia con su  hija Diana D. 5 años. Es una mujer llena D. energía y sobre todo emprendedora. Durante toda su vida ha trabajado para dar a su familia una vida diferente. Posee una tienda en su hogar D. residencia en la cual ofrece diversidad D. productos D. primera necesidad. Para Andrea lo más importante son los clientes  por  lo que siempre trata D. complacerlos en lo que pueD. y es por esta razón que se ha ganado la confianza D. muchas personas y cada vez la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión D. abastecer su negocio con variedad D. mercadería D. tienda para siempre estar un paso adelante D. la competencia. Para esto ha decidido solicitar este crédito para poder comprar variedad D. artículos tales como: huevos, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, sal, pan dulce, café, bebidas, golosinas, detergente, papel higiénico, y D. más artículos que sean atractivos para los clientes.  D. esta manera espera mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia que es lo más importante para ella.
texts.en: Andrea is 27 years old and lives in a home of her own with her five year old daughter Diana.  She is a woman full of energy and above all she is very enterprising.  She has worked all her life to give her family a different life.  She has a store in her home where she sells a variety of primary needs products.  The most important things to Andrea are her customers and she always tries to please them however she can.  It’s for this reason that she has earned the trust of many people and every day they prefer more and more to deal with her.  She has decided to stock her store with a variety of merchandise in order to be one step ahead of the competition.  It’s for this reason that she has decided to request this loan.  She will use the money to buy a variety of products, such as eggs, beans, rice, sugar, salt, pan dulce, coffee, drinks, snacks, detergent, bathroom tissue, and more items that will be attractive to her customers.  In this way she hopes to improve her family’s quality of life.  They are most important to her.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Viera

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, ao sul de Mocambique casado e pai de 1 filho de 4 anos de idade.Fez a 12ª classe e parou no mes passado devido ao trabalho. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe que vive com ele.
Saiu de Maputo para Tete devido aos estudos, foi sozinho e 2 anos depois voltou para formar familia agora é funcionario permanente na Direção Distrital da Educação como tecnico de informatica e tem um salario mensal de 7.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja fez emprestimo no BIM para iniciar a sua obra,o qual conseguiu pagar sem problemas.Mais tarde conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem são clientes e este e o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para sua obra DE CONSTRUCAO DE UMA CASA  (ferro, areia, cimento, blocos, pedra, e outros). 
Sonha em concluir a sua obra e montar um escritorio de informatica, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Viera was born in Maputo City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has a four-year-old son. Viera finished twelfth grade and quit going to school last month because of his job. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his mother who lives with him.

Viera left Maputo to move to Tete to study. He went alone and returned two years later to form a family here. Now he is a permanent employee of the District Office for Education as a computer technician and has a monthly salary of 7,000 meticais. He uses this money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account (at BIM).

He took out a loan from BIM Bank to begin his construction project, and he was able to pay it back with no problems. Later Viera learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers. This is his first loan from Hluvuku, and he is asking for 16,000 meticais, which he will use to buy materials (iron, sand, cement, blocks, stone and other items) to help construct his house.

Viera's dream is to finish his house and build a computer office. To do so he intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (iron, sand, cement, blocks, stone and other items).

loans.name: And Soukali Jeeguene Pire 7 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 membres qui habitent dans le village de Pire à cent km de DAKAR la capitale du Sénégal, leur activité principale est le commerce de produits agricoles  les tubercules de manioc. Elles sont expérimentées dans le domaine et disposent  d’une bonne  clientèle. Leur journée commence à 8 heures du matin et se  termine vers 20heures du soir. Avec ce financement elles comptent  acheter 100 sacs de manioc qu’elles vont revendre  au marché. Les revenus tirés de la vente du manioc leur permettra de renforcer leur commerce mais aussi de satisfaire les besoins de leurs enfants (paiement des frais de scolarité les frais médicaux et participer a l’entretien de la maison).
texts.en: This group is composed of 5 members who live in the village of Pire, 100 kilometers from DAKAR, the capital of Senegal.  Their main business is selling agricultural products, such as manioc tubers.  They are experienced in this field and have a strong client base.  Their days begin at 8 a.m. and end around 8 p.m.  With this funding, they plan to buy 100 bags of manioc that they will resell at the market.   The income earned from the sale of manioc will enable them to expand their business and to take care of their children’s needs (payment of school fees and medical expenses and helping with home maintenance).

loans.use: To buy manioc, ground nuts and millet

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr: Daniel est Salarié, né au Rwanda.et il est le client d’ACB depuis 2008. Il est marié, il  a 63 ans, il a 8 enfants entre 18 ans et 39 ans, 2 enfants vont à l’école, Il  a 4 ans des études secondaire. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter  portes, fenêtres, des ciments et payer main d’œuvre. Il  a connue des difficultés de non-remboursement de son prêt de la mort de son familier. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de valoriser de plus  sa maison pour élever les revenus qui viennent de la location. Pour ses ambitions il voudrait construire d’autres maisons à louer, et pour sa famille il voudrait payer le frais scolaire pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Daniel is a salaried man born in Rwanda. He became a client of ACB in 2008. He is 63 years old, married, and he has eight children between the ages of 18 and 39. Two of them go to school. He himself completed four years of secondary school. 

This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He will use the funds to buy doors, windows and cement, and to pay the costs of labor. He previously experience difficulties repaying a loan due to the death of a close friend.

His business growth strategy is to add value to his house in order to boost his rental income. His goal is to build more houses for rent, and to pay for his children’s tuition.

loans.use: to buy doors, windows, cement, and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Jorge

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Matola, provincia de Maputo, ao sul de Mocambique casado e pai de 6 filhos de idades entre 9 a 19 anos de idade.Fez a 6ª classe e parou quando perdeu o seu filho porque ficou sem forças de voltar a estudar. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 2 netos e sua mãe que vivem com ele.
Saiu da Matola para Boane com seus pais ainda pequeno,quando o seu pai recebeu a sua reforma nos CFM (caminhos de Ferro de Moçambique), tendo mais tarde afixado la a sua residencia. Trabalha como agente de serviço no Instituto Agrario de Boane a 23 anos e tem um rendimento mensal de 5.500.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM), conta com ajuda da sua esposa que é negociante.
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de conversas com colegas que tambem são clientes, e este é o seu sexto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para sua obra (construçao de uma casa, ou seja, moradia) (prancha, ferro, areia, cimento, chapas, pedra, e outros). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 5.200.00mt, 7.800.00mt, 10.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt,e  15.000.00mt. 
 Pretende concluir a sua obra e construir uma papelaria para ajudar a sua esposa no negocio e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Jorge was born in Matola City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has six children between the ages of 9 and 19. Jorge finished sixth grade and stopped school when he lost his son because he no longer had the will to return to his studies. He lives in his own house with his family and also supports two grandchildren and his mother, who live with him.

When he was young, Jorge left Matola to move to Boane with his parents when his father retired from CFM (Mozambique Railways), and later he made his home there. He has worked as a agent for Boane's Agrarian Institute for 23 years and has a monthly income of 5,500 meticais. He uses the money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account (at BIM). He also relies on the help of his wife, who is a businesswoman.

Jorge has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku by talking with coworkers who are also customers, and this is his sixth loan from Hluvuku. He is asking for 15,000 meticais, which he will use to buy construction materials (boards, iron, sand, cement, zinc sheets, stone and other items) for his housing project. The earlier loans were for 5,200 meticais, 7,800 meticais, 10,000 meticais, 10,000 meticais, and 15,000 meticais.

He intends to finish building and to build a stationery store to help his wife with her business, and to do this he plans to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (boards, iron, sand, cement, zinc sheets, stone, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials (iron, sand, cement, zinc sheets, stone and other items).

loans.name: Iris Carolina

texts.es: Iris Carolina de 29 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su esposo Samuel de 31 años  y dos hijos. Como toda mujer emprendedora Iris no quiso ser la excepción. Dentro de su hogar ha instalado un pequeño negocio  el cual consiste en una sala de belleza en donde ofrece todo tipo de corte, planchado y variedad de producto de belleza. Quiere surtir su negocio para ofrecer  mejor variedad de productos a sus clientes. Para esto necesita contar con los recursos económicos necesarios que le permitan realizar su sueño, es por esta razón que solicita el préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar diferentes artículos como: lociones tanto para hombre como para mujer, cremas para manos, cremas para el cabello, champo, maquillaje, esmaltes, jabón, tintes, etc. que son los productos que más se venden en su negocio. Con lo que espera obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Iris Carolina is 29 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, 31 year old Samuel, and their two children.  Like other entrepreneurial women, Iris didn’t want to be the exception.  She installed a small business in her home, where she has a beauty parlor and offers all sorts of cuts, styles, and also various beauty products.  She wants to stock her business so that she can offer a greater variety of products to her customers.  She needs to be able to count on financial resources in order to make her dream come true, so she is asking for this loan through INTEGRAL so that she can buy different items, such as perfumes for men and women, hand creams, hair cream, shampoo, makeup, nail polish, soaps, hair coloring, etc.  These are the products that sell the best in her business.  With this she hopes to increase her income, which will allow her to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, who is a married mother of three children, started her retail shop and bar business three years ago and she earns 300,000 Uganda shillings per week as profits. The 35-year-old lady explains that she gathered her capital from selling agriculture produce, the activity she still carries on. Her children are between 4 and 10 years of age, and this hardworking lady is happy to say that she has been able to send all her children to school.

Jane has a dream of expanding her business and having a family of self-reliance in terms of finances. With the Kiva loan, she plans to buy things like sugar, soap, salt, beans and posho (made from cassava) to increase her stock to meet all the demands of her customers

loans.use: To buy things like sugar, soap, salt, beans and posho (made from cassava) to increase the stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials (boards, iron, sand, cement, sheet metal, stone, and others).

loans.name: Macario

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Ile, provincia da Zambezia, ao norte de Mocambique casado e pai de 5 filhos de idades entre 4 a 20 anos de idade os mais velhos vão a Escola. Fez a 8ª classe e parou porque teve que ir ao combate durante a guerra, e voltou com problemas de vista. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais dois irmãos, enviando dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas alimentares.
Nasceu na Zambezia e veio a Maputo cumprindo o serviço militar obrigatorio, veio sozinho e mais tarde formou uma familia aqui. É funcionario permanente do Estado como policia de proteção a 35 anos e tem um rendimento mensal de 10.433.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja fez emprestimo no BIM no valor de 54.000.00mt,para iniciar a sua obra o qual conseguiu pagar sem dificudades. Conheceu Hluvuku apos a sua fundação, e este e o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para sua obra CONSTRUCAO DE UMA CASA, OU SEJA, MORADIA (prancha, tabuas, areia, cimento, chapas, pedra, e outros).
Sonha em concluir a sua obra, iniciar um negocio para a sua esposa e comprar uma motocerra para fabricar carvão apos a sua reforma,e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the Ile district in the Zambezia province in northern Mozambique.  He is married and is the father of five children ranging in age from four to 20-years-old.  The oldest are in school.  He completed eight years of schooling and stopped because he had to go fight in the war and he returned with vision problems.  He lives in his own house with his family and maintains two siblings as well by sending them money to help with their food expenses.

He was born in Zambezia and went to Maputo to comply with obligatory military service.  He was single when he went and later formed a family there.  He has worked for 35 years as a protection officer with the police and a permanent state employee and has a monthly salary of 10,433 meticais which he uses for household expenses and saves some in his bank account (through the World Bank).

He has already taken out a loan with the World Bank in the amount of 54,000 meticais to start his building project which he was able to pay off with no difficulties.  He heard about Hluvuku through their foundation and this is his fourth loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 15,000 meticais which he plans to use to buy materials for his building project (boards, planks, sand, cement, sheet metal, stone, and others).

His dream is to complete his building project to start a business for his wife and buy a chainsaw to make charcoal after his retirement and to do this he plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy materials for his building project (boards, planks, sand, cement, sheet metal, stone, and others).

loans.name: Blanca Yolanda

texts.es: Blanca Yolanda vive con su hijo en una zona muy concurrida ella posee una venta de panes y chocolate en tabletas que distribuye por la localidad, Su venta es muy famosa en el lugar pues los panes tienen un sabor exquisito y el chocolate es inigualable además tiene muy buenos precios y ofrece un servicio excelente, cualquiera que le compra el producto queda satisfecho. Blanca Yolanda es emprendedora con muchas metas por delante y está dispuesta a moldear su futuro para obtener grandes éxitos es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar panes y chocolate y así mantener su clientela. Blanca Yolanda tiene confianza que con su esfuerzo lograra darle a su familia una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Blanca Yolanda lives with her son in a very crowded neighborhood.  She sells tablets made from bread and chocolate which she distributes in the area.  Her product is very famous where she lives, because the breads taste exquisite and the chocolate is incomparable.  She also offers very good prices and excellent service; anyone who buys the product is satisfied.

Blanca Yolanda is enterprising with many goals for her future, and she is willing to shape her future to obtain great success.  This is why she decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan which will allow her to purchase bread and chocolate and so maintain her customer base. 

Blanca Yolanda is confident that through her effort, she will achieve economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy bread and chocolate.

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi comes from the village of Ghvankiti, Imereti Region, West Georgia. He is 58 years old and lives with his wife, Olga. Givi has a mini-bus and provides transportation services to people living in the Imereti Region. Olga is leading the agricultural business of the family. They have two sheep and sell lambs in the season. Also, the family owns one pig and sells piglets. Domestic animals are sold in Zestaponi, a nearby town. 

Givi requests credit for purchasing a cow. He and Olga will produce cheese and sell it in the Zestaponi market. It will increase the income of the family, which amounts currently to 650 Laris per month. 

Givi and Olga plan to use the increase in income as a result of the purchase of the cow for further expansion of their agro-business.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, ao sul de Mocambique solteira e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais não lembra as respectivas  idades somente que todos são maiores de idade. Fez a 2ª classe e parou por falta de condicoes financeiras, quando perdeu os eu pai. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe que vive com ela.
Nunca saiu de Maputo,apenas mudou com a sua mãe para Boane quando perdeu o pai e vive la ate hoje. É negociante permanente ha 15 anos e tem um rendimento mensal de 12.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de conversas com conhecidos que também são clientes desta instituição, e este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (oleo, arroz, amendoim, cervejas, refrescos, vinhos, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Sonha em concluir a sua obra, e ampliar o seu negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique.  She is single and the mother of five children.  She doesn’t remember their respective ages, only that all are adults.  She finished two years of schooling and stopped because of lack of money when she lost her father.  She lives in her own house with her family and maintains her mother who lives with her.  

She never left Maputo, she just moved with her mother to Boane when she lost her father and she has lived there since.  She has been working as a seller for 15 years and has a monthly salary of 12,000 (meticais) which she uses for household expenses and saves some of in her bank account.

She has never taken out loans with other banks.  She heard about Hluvuku through conversations with acquaintances who are also customers of this institution and this is her third loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 25,000 meticais which she plans to use to buy products (oil, rice, peanuts, beer, soft drinks, liquors, and others) to increase the quantity of her merchandise.  

She dreams of finishing her building project and expanding her business; to do this she intends to request more loans with Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy products (oil, rice, peanuts, beer, soft drinks, liquors, and others).

loans.name: Mary Languidey

texts.es: La señora Mary  oriunda D. la localidad D. la Guardia D. Santa Cruz, vive con el sr. Seferino,  viven en su propio domicilio que se encuentra ubicado Zona D. la guardia, su actividad económica es venta D. frutas según a la temporada, hace 22 años que se dedica a esta actividad, el destino del crédito es para la compra D. fruta D. temporada por mayor para surtir su puesto D. venta, la Sra. a pesar D. ser una persona mayor sigue trabajando, ya que esta es única fuente D. ingresos, se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Mary is originally from the town of La Guardia in Santa Cruz. She lives with Sr. Seferino in their own home in the District of La Guardia. She has a business selling fruit according to the season. Mary has been in business for 22 years.

This loan will be used to buy seasonal fruit in bulk so that she can restock her vending post. Despite being an older individual, Sra. Mary continues to work because this is her only source of income. She is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal fruit in bulk.

loans.name: Las Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es casada, tiene 38 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 6 hijos 2 D. los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al comercio, a la venta D. helados, inicio este negocio en un momento D. necesidad familiar y tener dinero para el sustento familiar y hasta el momento lleva 6 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

DeciD. organizar un  grupo y así poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital D. trabajo para la veta D. helados, va a comprar frutas, saborizantes, leche, y entre otros insumos necesarios para la elaboración D. helados D. diferentes tamaños y sabores. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza D. animales y al comercio.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca is 38 years old and married. She did not have the opportunity to study. Francisca has six children, two of whom are in school. She is a merchant who sells ice cream. Francisca started this business at a time of financial necessity and because she needed money to support her family. Now she has been in business for six years. She has the support of her husband, who is also a merchant.

Francisca decided to organize a group so that she could request a loan to increase her operating capital for selling ice cream. She plans to buy fruit, flavorings, milk, and other necessary supplies for making ice cream in different sizes and flavors. The other members of the group raise animals and have retail businesses.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making ice cream.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, ao sul de Mocambique viuva e mãe de 3 filhos de idades entre 7 a 17 anos de idade. Fez a 5ª classe e parou para ir ao lar e nunca mais conseguiu voltar a estudar. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, apenas mudou de casa quando foi ao lar. É negociante permanente ha 8 anos e tem um rendimento mensal de 5.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez da mobilização feita na sua zona por agentes desta instituição, e este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 23.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar MATERIAL DE CONSTRUCAO para aumentar a sua CASA.

Sonha em ampliar o seu negocio e aumentar a sua casa para oferecer mais conforto a sua familia,e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Gloria was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique.  She is a widow and the mother of three children with ages ranging from seven to 17-years-old.  She completed five years of schooling but stopped to spend time at home and was never able to return to her studies.  Gloria lives in her own home with her family and is not responsible for anyone else.  She never left Maputo and only changed houses when she stopped her schooling to go home.  She has been a businesswoman for eight years and has a monthly salary of 5.000 meticais (Mozambique currency) which she uses for the household expenses and saves some of in her bank account.

Gloria has never taken out loans with other banks.  She heard of Hluvuku through a mobilization movement done in her region by agents of this institution and this is her second loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 23,000 meticais.  She intends to use it to buy construction material to expand her merchandise.  

She dreams of expanding her business and adding on to her house to offer greater comfort to her family and to do this she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy cement, stone, and other materials.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Zulma tiene 32 años edad y tiene dos hijos. Ella es una persona responsable, amable y trabajadora y por esas cualidades le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Nueva Luz de Echarate” de la Asociación Arariwa. Zulma nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba  (La Convención, Cusco). Actualmente, Zulma vive en la ciudad de Echarate y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. 

Zulma se dedica a la venta de mates, hamburguesas y comida de forma ambulatoria. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. La socia trabaja desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde todos los días. En esta oportunidad Zulma requiere el préstamo para comprar sillas, mesas, cubiertos, insumos  y otras cosas  más. Su sueño de Zulma es completar de abrir un restaurante.

La ciudad de Echarate es la ciudad capital del distrito de Echarate de la Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.
texts.en:
Zulma is 32 years old and has two children. She is a responsible, friendly, and hardworking person. Because of these qualities, she was invited to participate in the Communal Bank “Nueva Luz de Echarate” (New Light of Echarate), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. Zulma was born in the city of Quillabamba, La Convención, Cusco. She currently lives in the city of Echarate, where she has developed her business activities.

Zulma sells mate, hamburgers, and food as a street vendor. She has been in business for three years and has done very well. Zulma works every day from 9am to 4pm. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy chairs, tables, cutlery, supplies, and other items. Her dream is to complete the opening of a restaurant.

The city of Echarate is the capital city of the District of Echarate in La Convención Province. It is an important center of commerce for the Lares and La Convención Valleys. The main business activities involve the production of coca leaves, coffee, cacao, and fruit.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables, cutlery, supplies, and other items.

loans.name: Santa Margarita Group

texts.es:
La formación del presente comité inició gracias a la iniciativa de una de las miembros. Santa Margarita fue denominado el comité y actualmente se encuentra en el séptimo ciclo, con 15 integrantes, es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, ellas se esfuerzan al máximo para la consecución de los objetivos que se propusieron.
El comité lo conforman mujeres muy sacrificadas que han luchado toda su vida para llevar adelante a sus familias a pesar de los obstáculos que siempre existen.
La Sra Tomasa quien se dedica hace varios años a la venta de comida y repostería ella se levanta muy temprano a preparar su comida para  vender. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes ya que sus platos son muy ricos. Le gustaría, algún día pode abrir un restaurante donde vender sus alimentos
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, huevos, leche, azúcar y otros, insumos necesarios para la elaboración de las comidas y dulces que la señora prepara. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
This committee was formed on the initiative of its members.  The Santa Margarita committee, as it's called, is now in its seventh round of funding.  The 15 members of the group are responsible, hard-working women who strive day after day to meet the goals they've set for themselves.
The group's members have sacrificed a lot, year after year, to support their families and overcome the huge obstacles they've had to face.
Sra. Tomasa has operated a food- and baked goods-sales business for several years.  She gets up early to make the goods she sells.  She says that she has many customers because the food she makes is very good.  She would like to open a restaurant one day. 
She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy meat, eggs, milk, sugar and the other supplies she needs to make the meals and sweets that she sells.  She is grateful to the Fundacion for the opportunities it has given her.

loans.use: buy supplies for her food-sales business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Moamba, provincia de Maputo, ao sul de Mocambique solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 2 e 5 anos de idade. Fez a 6ª classe e parou para ir ao lar,e nunca mais teve tempo de voltar a estudar. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta os seus pais que vivem com ela.
Nasceu em Moamba depois saiu com os pais para Maputo ainda pequena. É negociante possui um salão de cabelereiro e faz refeições para venda, actividades que desenvolve ha mais de 11 anos e consegue um rendimento mensal de 5.600.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM) e atravez de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Ja fez emprestimos no BIM nos valores de: 4.000.00mt, e 10.000.00mt que usou na aquisição de terreno,os quais conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma mobilização feita na sua zona por agentes desta instituição, e este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para sua obra (areia, ferro, cimento,  pedra, e outros).
Sonha em concluir a sua obra ,e ampliar o seu negocio construindo um estabelecimento de venda, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the Moamba district in Maputo province in southern Mozambique.  She is a single mother of two children who are two and five-years-old.  She completed six years of schooling and stopped to go be at home and never again had time to return to her studies.  She lives in her own house with her family and maintains her parents who live with her.  

She was born in Moamba and later left with her parents for Maputo when she was still young.  She is a businesswoman with a hair salon and also makes meals to sell.  She has been doing this for more than 11 years and earns a monthly salary of 5,600 meticais (Mozambique currency) which she uses for household expenses and saves some of in her bank account (though BIM, a bank) and through the “xitique” (a traditional rotating savings bank contributed to communally).

She has already taken out loans with BIM in the amount of 4,000 meticais and 10,000 meticais which she used to acquire a land parcel and which she paid off with no difficulty.  She heard of Hluvuku through a mobilization made in her region by agents of the institution and this is her first loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 20,000 meticais.  She plans to use this to buy materials for her building project like sand, iron, cement, stone, and other materials.  

She dreams of finishing her building project and expanding her business by building a place to sell and for this she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her building project (sand, iron, cement, stone, and other materials).

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly, who is a married mother of 2 children, started her retail shop and bar business 5 years ago and she earns 180,000 Uganda shillings per week as profits.The 35 year old lady explains that she gathered her capital from selling coffee, the activity she still carries on. Her children are 18 and 13 years of age and this hard working lady is happy to say that she has been able to send all of her children to school. 

Jolly has a dream of expanding her business and having a self reliant family, in terms of finances. With the Kiva loan, she plans to buy stock for the shop like sugar, soap, salt, beans and posho (porridge made of cassava) to increase her inventory to meet all the demands of her customers as well as to buy more beer and other drinks.

loans.use: to buy stock for the shop like sugar, soap, salt, beans, posho to increase her inventory to meet all the demands of her customers as well as to buy more beer and other drinks.

loans.name: Berta Maribel

texts.es: Berta Maribel D. 42 años D. edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo Santiago, un hermano y un hijo el cual estudia. Berta trabaja duramente para poder colaborar con la situación económica D. su hogar. Hace ya varios años que logró establecer una pequeña tiendita dentro D. su hogar D. residencia, además D. una pupuseria. Estos negocios le han ayudado D. mucho ya que su esposo es agricultor y no tienen otra fuente D. ingreso. Berta se ha organizado para que cada fin D. semana además D. atender la tienda poder vender pupusas, negocio que le genera otros ingresos para poder sobrevivir. Berta no pierD. oportunidad para hacer negocio es una mujer muy emprendedora que logra todo lo que se propone. Es muy conocida en la zona gracias a su carisma y buena disposición en su trabajo y además por que los clientes siempre encuentran lo que buscan y confían en la calidad e higiene D. las ricas pupusas que ofrece. Ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con la fe  puesta en Dios que le ayudara a obtener resultados positivos con el fin D. aspirar a una mejor calidad D. vida. El crédito lo necesita para comprar variedad D. productos D. tienda como: azúcar, golosinas, papel, detergente, y la materia prima necesaria para la elaboración D.  las ricas pupusas como: frijoles, maíz, gas propano, etc.
texts.en:
Berta Maribel is 42 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Santiago, a brother, and a child who is in school. She works hard in order to contribute toward the household finances. Several years ago, she established a small store in her home. She also operates a “pupuseria”. These businesses have been a great help since her husband is a farmer and they have no other source of income. Berta keeps herself organized so that she can sell pupusas every weekend. This business enables her to generate extra income so that her family can survive. Berta does not waste any opportunity to do business since she is a very enterprising woman who accomplishes everything she plans. She is well-known in the area thanks to her charisma and willingness to work. In addition, all of her customers always find what they are looking for and trust the quality and cleanliness by which she offers her delicious pupusas.

With her faith in God, Berta decided to apply for a loan from Apoyo Integral to help obtain positive results so that she can achieve a better quality of life. This loan is needed to buy a variety of products for her store such as sugar, candy, paper, detergent, and supplies for making her delicious pupusas such as beans, corn, propane gas, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, candy, paper, detergent, and supplies for making "pupusas".

loans.name: Justina

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade da Matola, provincia de Maputo, ao sul de Mocambique, solteira e mãe de 1 filha de 5 anos de idade.Fez a 7ª classe e parou quando começou a trabalhar e nunca mais teve tempo de voltar a estudar. vive na casa de serviços com a sua filha e sustenta a sua mãe enviando dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas alimentares.
Nasceu na Matola, depois saiu para Boane a procura de emprego. É funcionaria permanente a 16 anos e tem um rendimento mensal de 4.700.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Ja fez emprestimo no Barclays no valor de: 30.000.00mt, usou na aquisição e legalização do terreno, o qual conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades.Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem são clientes desta instituição.  Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, ferro, chapas, cimento,  pedra, e outros) para  dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 15.000.00mt aplicado para a mesma actividade.
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem problemas, o seu desejo é concluir a sua obra , mobiliar para oferecer mais conforto a sua familia, para tal pretende solicitar mais emprestimos.
texts.en:
She was born in the city of Matola in Maputo province in southern Mozambique.  She is a single mother of one daughter who is five-years-old.  She completed seven years of schooling and stopped when she began to work and never had time to return to her studies.  She lives in employee housing with her daughter and maintains her mother by sending money for food expenses.

She was born in Matola and later left for Boane to look for work.  She has been a permanent employee for 16 years and has a monthly salary of 4,700 meticais (Mozambique currency) which she uses for her household expenses and saves some of in her bank account.

She has already taken out a loan with Barclays in the amount of 30,000 meticais which she use to acquire and pay for permits for a parcel of land which she was able to pay off with no difficulty.  She heard of Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 20,000 meticais which she intends to use to buy construction materials such as sand, iron, sheet metal, cement, stone, and other materials.  Her first loan was for 15,000 meticais and was used for the same purpose. She is confident that she will be able to pay it off with no problems.  Her hope is to finish her building project and move to give her family greater comfort and to do this she plans to request more loans.

loans.use: to buy construction material (sand, iron, sheet metal, cement, stone, and other materials).

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 43 años edad, tiene una hija y nació en la ciudad de Echarate (La Convención, Cusco). Actualmente, Victoria vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Victoria tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes  en su domicilio. Ya son seis años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. La socia trabaja desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche todos los días. En esta oportunidad Victoria requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, leche y otras cosas más. Su sueño de Victoria es abrir un mini market. 

La ciudad de Echarate es la ciudad capital del distrito de Echarate de la Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.
texts.en:
Victoria is 43 years old and has a daughter. She was born in the city of Echarte (La Convención, Cusco). Victoria currently lives in the city where she was born and has developed her business activities. She has a small grocery store in her home. Victoria has already been in business for six years and has done very well. She works every day from 5am to 9pm. Victoria is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, milk, and other items. Her dream is to open a mini-market.

The city of Echarate is the capital city of the District of Echarate in La Convención Province. It is an important center of commerce for the Lares and La Convención Valleys. The main business activities involve the production of coca leaves, coffee, cacao, and fruit.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase iron and sheets of metal.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 37-years-old and lives in Latacunga, Ecuador. She is married and lives with her husband and two children. Gloria has a strong character, her personality is friendly, and she is a hardworking and responsible person. Her business is in repairing and selling shoes. She is seeking a loan to increase her business and her income. In Ecuador, it is common for people to have their shoes repaired rather than replaced. Gloria will use part of her loan to purchase the supplies she needs to repair shoes. Additionally, she will use part of her loan to fix up part of her house to rent out as an apartment and further increase her family’s income. 

Gloria began her shoe repair business twelve years ago. This is her first microloan from FODEMI. She hopes it will be a good support for her to finish fixing up the apartment and to achieve her other goals to increase her family’s income. Gloria’s dreams are to complete fixing up her house, to expand her business, and to increase her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for shoe repair and to fix up part of her house to rent out as an apartment.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La señora Rosmery oriunda de la localidad de San José Santa Cruz, vive con el sr. Rider, tienen dos hijos pequeños, viven en su propio domicilio que se encuentra ubicado en el zona los pinos, su actividad económica es venta de ropa, joyas y productos cosméticos por catalogo de las distintas empresas de cosméticos a nivel mundial, hace ocho años que se dedica a esta actividad, también sale a vender comida los fines de semana en el mercado de la zona. El destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería (cosméticos de promoción), se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosmery is originally from the town of San José in Santa Cruz. She lives with Sr. Rider and they have two young children. They live in their own home in the District of Los Pinos. Rosmery has a business selling clothes, jewelry, and cosmetics through catalogs of various international companies. She has been in business for eight years. Rosmery also sells food on the weekends at the local market.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise (cosmetics through a promotional offer). She is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics through a promotional offer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Mocambique, casada e mãe de 3 filhos de idades entre 1 a 17 anos. Fez a 9ª classe e parou quando foi ao lar e nunca mais teve tempo de voltar a estudar. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu de Maputo apenas mudou de bairro quando foi ao lar. É Modista ha mais de  7 anos, foi formada pela BENINA e actualmente produz roupa diversa para homens mulheres e crianças obtendo um rendimento mensal de 6.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de vizinhas que tambem são clientes desta instituição, e este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar tecidos para aumentar o stock.
Sonha em abrir uma empresa de roupas onde pudesse dar aulas de costura e catering, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique.  She is married and has three children with ages ranging from one to 17-years-old.  She completed nine years of schooling and stopped to work at home and never had time to go back to continue her studies.  She lives in her own home with her family and is not responsible for anyone else.  She never left Maputo and only changed neighborhoods when she left school.  She has been a seamstress for more than seven years.  She was trained by Bernina (a sewing maching company) and currently makes all kinds of clothing for men, women, and children; earning a monthly salary of 6,000 meticais (Mozambique currency) which she uses for the household expenses and saves some of in her bank account.

She has never taken out loans with other banks.  She heard of Hluvuku through neighbors who are also clients of this institution and this is her first loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 20,000 meticais.  She intends to use it to buy fabrics to expand her supplies.

She dreams of opening a clothing business where she could give classes on sewing and catering.  To do this she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku,

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Djromahuton 14 Group

texts.fr: DJROMAHUTON 14 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amis et qui appartiennent à une même association d'artisans au Bénin. Le représentant du groupe, Yves Magloire (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans et est marié à une couturière du nom de Bernadette. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, et un autre enfant à charge. Yves Magloire et sa femme vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Yves Magloire a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Yves Magloire est un brodeur qui a son atelier installé dans une ville du Bénin. Il y a près de treize ans que Yves Magloire exerce cette activité, qui lui procure des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins et à satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. La clientèle de Yves Magloire s'agrandit de plus en plus, et Yves Magloire a besoin d'une autre machine qui lui permettra de mieux répondre à leur demande dans un bref délai. Pour ce faire, Yves Magloire sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe DJROMAHUTON 14, un premier crédit. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: The Djromahuton 14 group comprises three people who are friends and belong to the same craftsman association in Benin. The group representative, Yves Magloire (with the raised hand in the photo), is 40 years old and married to a seamstress named Bernadette. The couple have three children, all of whom are in school, and an additional child in their care. Yves Magloire and his wife live together with their children and provide for the family together. Yves Magloire ended his studies at the secondary level. He is an embroiderer and has established his own workshop in a city in Benin. For close to 13 years, he has run this business, which provides him with an income to help meet his needs and those of his family. His clientele is steadily increasing, and Yves Magloire needs another machine that will allow him to better respond to their demands quickly. To do this, he is seeking a first loan along with the other members of his Djromahuton 14 group. This loan will allow them to better respond to the demands of their customers and generate higher profits.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Mukisa Women's Group

texts.en:
A decade is the time period that 38 year old Zulaika has been involved in a general merchandise retail business. The mother of 6 plies her business in the Jinja district. She was previously involved in farming and grocery store businesses, respectively. Many low denominator people find commodities sold by these small retail enterprises much cheaper than those sold by the supermarket stores which are mushrooming up in almost every town. This, therefore, means the small retail businesses can be lucrative. However of recent, the status quo has given rise to a rising middle class. These middle class people are increasingly partial to goods sold in the supermarkets, despite the price difference. This has, however, not dampened the spirits of most retail business people, including Zulaika. Her 10 year old experience in this business is clear testimony to her hard work and determination. She, however, has never rested on her laurels. She strives day in, day out to make new plans for her business, including expansion plans. She says she still has a lot of leeway to make up to see all her plans come to fruition.

Most of these retail businesses also operate on loans and the credit crunch in many respects adversely affected them. Zulaika, took this all in her stride. 
On the side, she ekes out a supplementary income from a poultry sales business. On a weekly basis, she makes gross profits in the amount of Ugandan shillings 120,000. She says with this requested Kiva loan, she intends to purchase more retail commodities like sugar, salt, basins, toothpaste, beans, maize flour, rice, etc. to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities like sugar, salt, basins, toothpaste, beans, maize flour, rice, etc to resell.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, provincia de Maputo, sul de Mocambique, casado e pai de 6 filhos dos quais não lembra as respectivas idades mas todos vão a Escola. Fez a 4ª classe no tempo colonial e porque nessa altura não podia passar desse nivel parou  e mais tarde por falta de condicoes financeiras tambem não continuou mais. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu de Maputo apenas saiu de Namaacha para Boane com a sua familia devido a questõs de emprego. Trabalha como funcionario permanente ha 10 anos na empreasa de produção e venda de Banana (BANANALANDIA) e tem um salario mensal de 2.340.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e com ajuda da sua esposa que faz negocio consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de colegas que tambem são clientes desta instituição, e este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.500.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção ( cimento, blocos, areia, pedra e outros). O emprestimo anterior foi de 8.500.00mt e foi para a construção.
Sonha em concluir a sua obra, mobiliar e apostar na criação de gado bovino, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the Namaacha district in Maputo province in southern Mozambique.  He is married and a father to six children.  He doesn’t remember their respective ages, but all go to school.  He completed four years of schooling during colonial times and because he could not pass that level he stopped and later he didn’t continue because of lack of money.  He lives in his own house with his family and they aren’t responsible for anyone else.  

He never left Maputo and only left Namaacha for Boane with his family for employment reasons.  He has worked as a permanent employee for ten years in a business producing and selling bananas called Bananalandia and receives a monthly salary of 2,340 meticais (Mozambique currency) which he uses for household expenses and, with the help of his wife who has a business, manages to save some of it in his bank account.

He has never taken out loans with other banks.  He heard about Hluvuku through acquaintances who are also customers of this institution.  This is his second loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 10,500 meticais which he plans to use to buy construction materials (cement, blocks, sand, stone, and other materials).  The previous loan was for 8,500 meticais and was for construction.

He dreams of completing his building project, moving, and investing in cattle breeding.  To do that he intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, blocks, sand, stone, and other materials.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita de cincuenta y seis años de edad vive con su madre y su hijo en casa propia. Ella posee una tortillería en su residencia, ya tiene muchos años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues tiene un excelente servicio, es muy amable con las personas que la visitan siempre tiene una sonrisa en el rostro para ellos, además tiene gran agilidad para la elaboración de las mismas y atiende a los clientes en poco tiempo. Margarita es muy dedicada en su trabajo para ella las batallas más importantes de la vida son las que peleamos diariamente para alcanzar nuestros sueños y ella está dispuesta a esforzarse por su objetivo es por eso que le solicita a ITNEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor para seguir produciendo. Margarita tiene la esperanza que de esta forma le dará a su familia una seguridad económica en el hogar.
texts.en:
Margarita is 56 years old and lives in her own home with her mother and her son. She has a tortilla shop in her home and has been in business for many years. Margarita has many customers since she provides excellent service. She is friendly to everyone who visits her and always has a smile on her face. Margarita possesses great agility since she is able to make tortillas and attend to her customers in a short amount of time. She is very dedicated to her work since the most important battles of life are fought on a daily basis in order to achieve one’s dreams. For this reason, she is willing to work toward that goal.

Margarita is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy corn in bulk and continue her production. She has hopes of providing her family with financial security.

loans.use: to purchase corn in bulk.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Yungaqui, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marisol; la socia tiene 26 años; la socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijos, de 1 y 5 meses;  La socia se dedica al comercio minorista la socia viaja a Juliaca y trae artefactos para la venta al por menor, la socia trae radios que son las más cotizadas, también televisores, licuadoras, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de artefactos, para esto la socia viajar a la Ciudad de Puno y al distrito de Juliaca que es considerada la capital comercial de Perú aquí se fabrican todo tipo de artefactos y de ropa hecha en la misma ciudad y también repuestos y motores de autos como mismas copias fieles de los originales. L a socia desea viajar y comprar artefactos a bajo costo para traerlos al poblado de Yungaqui a venderlos a precios accesibles para los bolsillos de los pobladores. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de artefactos.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Marisol is a member of the Communal Bank “Taytacha Señor de Ccoyllority de Yungaqui” which is located in the District of Yungaqui, Anta Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 26 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has a child who is 17 months old. Marisol is an informal merchant who travels to Juliaca and brings back appliances to sell at retail. Radios are the most requested items, but she also brings back televisions and blenders. Marisol wants a loan to invest in the purchase of appliances. She plans to travel to the city of Puno and the District of Juliaca, which is considered to be the commercial capital of Peru. All types of appliances and clothing are manufactured here, as well as automobile replacement engines and spare parts that are just as good as the originals. Marisol wants to travel so that she can buy appliances at low cost and bring them to the town of Yungaqui to sell at prices that are affordable for the pocketbooks of the local residents. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of these appliances.

Marisol is very pleased with and appreciative of the loan that has been provided. She promises to complete her loan payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to purchase appliances.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca and her family decided to expand their business, Jefeisa Enterprises, to El Paso, Texas because they saw an opening in the wood pallet market in the United States. She began Jefeisa, a wood-pallet recycling enterprise, 11 years ago in Monterrey, Mexico. Three years ago, Blanca decided to expand to El Paso by opening a distribution center where the goods created by Jefeisa in Mexico could be sold in the US. Blanca’s business is a family endeavor, run by her, her husband and her son, Filipe.

Jefeisa Enterprises recycles wood pallets for use in commercial packaging and distribution. They purchase used wood pallets, like those shown in her picture, from stores like Sam’s Club, take them apart and use this material to create new pallets for a client. Currently, all of the breaking down and reassembling of the wood pallets occurs in their Monterrey, Mexico plant, while the El Paso business functions as a distribution center to U.S. clients. Though the Monterrey plant employs about a dozen employees, Blanca and her family run the U.S. branch by themselves.

Blanca says that Jefeisa’s biggest challenge was attempting to break into the U.S. market with almost no knowledge of the American wood pallet business. Since she and her husband have limited knowledge of the English language, after they moved to El Paso, they relied on their son’s schooling to translate complex and confusing documents for the business. However, by taking classes at a local community college, Blanca was able to learn about the U.S. business paperwork, create a business plan and successfully break into the U.S. wood pallet industry. Today, she is proud to say that overcoming these enormous obstacles has been the biggest success her El Paso branch has seen so far.

In the future, Blanca aims to open a processing plant in El Paso to meet the needs of her American clients and to provide employment to her El Paso community. In preparation for this, Blanca has purchased a large plot of land and a building in which the processing plant is to be located. However, since the building wasn’t built to support the electrical needs of an industrial plant, the wiring and power infrastructure cannot, in its current form, be used to fit her needs.

This loan will help Blanca further her goal of opening a plant by updating the electricity on her newly purchased land. She says it will pay for the materials, labor and construction necessary to power the machinery needed to convert her building into a plant. Without it, this expansion would have happened at a much slower pace, as Blanca’s family has not built the kind of credit necessary to obtain a business loan from a traditional bank in the U.S. 

With the aid of this loan and the continued support of her family, Blanca will continue to supply her American clients with affordable wood pallets and will expand her business to offer employment opportunities to her El Paso community.

loans.use: to pay for electrical updates to her future wood pallet processing plant

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Yungaqui, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Edelmira; la socia tiene 37 años; la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos, de 14, 12, 6  años de edad;  La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de bebidas y de comidas, la socia elabora las diferentes comidas para llevarlas a vender a la feria la tablada todos los viernes y fines de semana en general, la socia tiene una carpa en la cual termina de darle el toque final a sus diferentes potajes y también ofrece algunas cervezas y gaseosas; la socia trabaja los fines de semana y los otros días ella se encarga de atender a sus animales en casa  tiene animales menores como aves de corral, cuyes y chanchos. La socia desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor como son fideos, aceite por bidones, papas, arroz y otros para la elaboración de sus diversos potajes.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Edelmira is a member of the Communal Bank “Taytacha Señor de Ccoyllority de Yungaqui” which is located in the District of Yungaqui, Anta Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 37 years old, married, and has three children (ages 14, 12, 6). Edelmira buys and sells beverages and food. She prepares different dishes to sell at the fair every Friday and on the weekends. Edelmira has a tent where she serves the various foods that she offers. She also sells beer and sodas. Edelmira works on the weekends and spends the other days tending to her animals at home. She raises small animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs. Edelmira wants a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of ingredients in bulk such as noodles, drums of oil, potatoes, rice, and other supplies used in the preparation of her various dishes.

She is very pleased and grateful for the support provided through this loan. Edelmira promises to complete her payments according the established terms.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, drums of oil, potatoes, rice, and other supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo de sesenta y dos años de edad vive con su compañera de vida en casa propia en una localidad muy concurrida. El posee un molino y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo visita a diario pues el servicio que Ricardo les ofrece es inigualable, muele harinas, maiz, frijoles, chicharrones, yuca, por ello las personas siempre quedan satisfechas; Ricardo quiere estar adelante de la competencia y está dispuesto a esforzarse duro en el trabajo, pero él sabe que para que funcione su esfuerzo necesita propósito y dirección y el quiere mantener a flote el negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar un nuevo molino y reparar el que no tiene en uso de esa forma mantendrá los clientes y le dará a su familia la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 62 years old and lives with his life partner in their own house, located in a very busy community. He owns a mill and already has many customers who visit him daily because the service Ricardo offers is unmatched. He grinds flours, corn, beans, pork scratchings and yucca. His customers always leave satisfied.

Ricardo wants to keep ahead of the competition and he is ready to put a great deal of effort into his business. However, he knows that for his efforts to work he needs purpose and direction. He wants to keep his business afloat so he requested this loan through INTEGRAL. It will allow him to buy a new mill and to repair another that he doesn't currently have in use. This way he will be able to maintain his customers and to give his family the opportunity for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a new mill and to repair an old one

loans.name: Maynelly

texts.es:
La ciudad de Echarate es la ciudad capital del distrito de Echarate de la Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.

Maynelly tiene 22 años edad, tiene dos hijas y nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba (La Convención, Cusco). Actualmente, Maynelly vive en la ciudad Echarate y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Maynelly es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora, responsable y amable se dedica a la venta de refrigerios, frutas, gelatinas de forma ambulatoria. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. La socia trabaja desde las 9 a 11 de la  mañana todos los días. En esta oportunidad Maynelly requiere el préstamo para comprar sandillas. Su sueño de Maynelly comprarse un carrito salchipapero y pollipapero.
texts.en: Echarate is the capital city of Echarate district in the province of La Convención. It is an important commercial center for the Lares and La Convención valleys. The main economic activities there are coca, coffee, cocoa, and fruit production. Maynelly is 22 years old, has two daughters, and was born in the city of Quillabamba (La Convención, Cusco). Currently, Maynelly lives and works in the city of Echarate. She is a hard-working woman who is enterprising, responsible, and friendly. She sells snacks, fruits, and gelatin in an ambulatory manner.
