El grupo “Mujeres Activas” es un grupo de 15 mujeres que son muy bien organizada, unidas, trabajadoras y solidarias unas con otras. Estas señoras son de la ciudad de Villarrica, y todas son vecinas y amigas. Se reúnen quincenalmente para brindarse apoyo y ayuda las unas a las otras en su esfuerzos a mejorar su situación económica. Estas senoras estan muy animados para seguir participando en este programa, mejorando sus actividades económicas.
La Sra. Lucila es artesana, se dedica a esto desde que era niña, ya que su madre se lo había enseñado. Gracias a su arte ella puede ganar los ingresos que necesita para satisfacer las necesidades del Hogar. Ella sueña con que el arte de Paraguay sea conocido por todo el mundo. Ella comenta que todo su esfuerzo es por brindarle a su familia un mejor futuro.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, pinturas, hilos, agujas, y todo lo demás que necesita para la elaboración de sus artesanías.
texts.en:
The groups “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) is made up of 15 very organized, united, hard-working and cooperative women who help each other.  They are from Villarrica and all are friends and neighbors.  They meet every two weeks to offer support and help to each other in their effort to improve their economic situation.  They are very enthusiastic about continuing to participate in this program with their businesses.

Lucila has worked as an artisan since she was a child when her mother taught her.  Thanks to her art she can earn income that she needs to cover household expenses.  She dreams that she will become known throughout the world with her Paraguayan art.  She tells us that her efforts are because she wants to offer her family a better future.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, paints, thread, needles and all that she needs to create her handicrafts.

loans.use: To buy fabric, paints, thread, needles and more

loans.name: Las Amigas De Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
La Alcancía Comunal "LAS AMIGAS DE LAS ANGELES"

La Alcancía Comunal "LAS AMIGAS DE LAS ANGELES" está formada por 7 socias que cada día salen a trabajar para llevar el alimento y el sostén a sus hogares a pesar de los problemas familiares que sufren.
Gladys es la presidenta de este grupo, quien fue elegida por su amino y jovialidad, ella se dedica a la venta de dulces frente a un colegio que se ubica cerca a su casa, en donde también se encarga de hacer la limpieza, a su vez tiene una moto-taxi.
Gladys tiene un gran deseo de salir adelante, tiene 2 hijas quienes son su inspiración, ella también como todas tiene sueños que cumplir, para lo cual no duda en dar lo mejor de sí para lograrlo.
texts.en:
The “Las Amigas de las Angeles” Communal Bank

The “Las Amigas de las Angeles” Communal Bank is made up of 7 members who work each day to bring food and sustenance to their homes, in spite of the family difficulties they suffer. 

Gladys is the president of this group. She was chosen for her vitality and joviality. She sells sweets in front of a high school that is located near her house. She also cleans houses and also has a motorcycle taxi.

Gladys has a great desire to get ahead. She has 2 daughters who are her inspiration. She, like the others, has dreams to achieve, which is why she knows she will give her best to achieve them.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, which includes buying sweets, and also maintenance for a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen del Carmen nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este grupo es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, tanto social como económicamente, todas ellas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Olga, es una mujer emprendedora e innovadora, ella se dedica a la elaboración y posterior venta de comidas de todo tipo. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada, pues cuenta que todos los días se levanta a muy tempranas horas de la mañana para ir a comprar los ingredientes frescos para sus comidas. Ella dice que con el correr del tiempo ya tiene una clientela bien formada. Gracias a su trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, pollo, especias, fideos, arroz, en fin, todo lo que necesitara para la elaboración de sus comidas. Ella agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Carmen Communal Bank was born with the effort and support of another communal bank that was found working in the area.  The group is from the city of San Lorenzo.  They established the growth of each one of them, as much social as financial, as their main objective.  All of them are recognized in the area as very hard-working women.

Olga is a very enterprising and innovative woman.  She makes and later sells all types of food.  She is a very self-sacrificing woman.  She says that every day she gets up in the very early hours of the morning in order to go buy the fresh ingredients for her food.   

She says that over time she has gotten a good customer base.  Thanks to her work she has been able to get ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy meat, chicken, spices, noodles, rice, and finally, everything she will need to make her food.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it offers her.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, rice, and noodles to make food.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.ru:
Виктория не замужем. Вот уже 5 лет, как она имеет свой бизнес и продает женскую одежду: сарафаны, майки, юбки, брюки и пр. Ее тогровая точка расположена в Тогровом Центре «Юбилейный». Это хорошее, проходное место, где постоянно находится много потенциальных покупателей. 

Виктория всегда старается подбирать ходовой товар хорошего качества. У нее есть постоянные покупатели, которым нравится скупляться у Виктории. Ее бизнес идет хорошо и приносит стабильный доход. 

Виктория просит выдать ей кредит на сумму 10,000 гривен для увеличения ассортимента товара. Она планирует получить дополнительную прибыль и потратить ее на улучшение своих жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Victoria is single.  It is five years since she has her own business selling women’s clothing: sundresses, tops, skirts, trousers etc. Her stall is located in the “Jubilee” shopping center. This is a good location with a lot of shopper traffic, where there are always many potential customers. 

Victoria always does her best to select high-quality goods that are in demand. She has many loyal customers who like to purchase from her. Her business is developing well and bringing her a stable income. Victoria is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH in order to enhance her stock. She plans to earn an additional income and use it to improve her  housing conditions.

loans.use: to increase her stock of summer goods

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Luis trabaja en el transporte público, pertenece al sindicato mixto de Transportista, trabaja en la línea de taxi trufis, con una experiencia superior a 4 años en el rubro y en la misma línea. Vive en la casa de sus papás, tiene un hijo, que lo cuida con su abuela, ya que es padre soltero, es una persona que sabe salir adelante por el bienestar de su hijo, ya que esta es única fuente de ingresos. El crédito es para mantenimiento de su vehículo, ya que le esta presentando fallas y esto no le permite brindar un buen servicio, es una persona trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Luis works in public transport.  He belongs to a drivers' union and works on a fixed taxi route.  He has more than four years experience in his field, working on this particular route.  Luis lives in his parents' home and has one son who he cares for together with his grandmother as he is a single father.  Luis is a person who knows how to get ahead for the sake of his son.  This is his only source of income.

Luis is requesting this loan to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle as it is experiencing some faults which means he is not able to provide a good service.  He is a hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have provided.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you teachers of a leading secondary school in Makeni. Seventeen out of the 70 staff of this institution have come to SMT to apply for a loan of 15,440,000.00 Sierra Leone leones (SLL). School staff from this institution and indeed, from many other institutions in different walks of life within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. These loans are helpful as they can allow them invest in something that their salaries alone cannot do. For example, some of them may buy a plot of land, others will buy house-building materials, some will buy household furniture, some will use the loan to pay school fees for their children, while others will use the loan to invest in his/her business. At the end of each month, the institution’s bursar deducts the repayment from their salaries and repays SMT on their behalf.

Zainab (third from left) is a senior teacher at the school and leader of this group of teachers. The 47-year-old woman is married and has five children. She has been in the teaching profession for 26 years. A native of Makeni, Zainab backs her teaching profession with some trading. She supplies cosmetics – body sprays, body powders, etc. Zainab has requested this loan in order to buy more goods to add to her business. She will use her share of the loan to buy more cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Sara Biviana

texts.es: Sara Biviana tiene 54 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ropa. Actualmente tiene una gran cantidad de clientes que le solicitan variedad de productos, ella es una persona muy carismática y que disfruta de su actividad económica. Desde joven se ha dedicado al comercio ya que ha tenido que luchar para mantener a sus 7 hijos que actualmente ninguno depende de ella es una persona muy trabajadora y ha sabido administrar su negocio muy bien. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, trajes y otros.
texts.en: Sara Biviana is 54 years old and buys and sells clothing and has a large number of customers who solicit a large variety of products.  She is a very charismatic person who enjoys her work and has been a merchant since she was young and has had to make an effort to support her seven children.  Now none of them are dependent on her.  She is a hard working person and has managed her business well.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, suits, and other things.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Max Glen

texts.es: El cliente Max es carpintero dedicado a la fabricación de muebles y todo trabajo en madera, a  su corta edad ya logro consolidar la calidad de sus productos, obteniendo buena clientela por este aspecto, el durante toda la semana trabaja arduamente en su taller para poder entregar los trabajos en fin de semana como queda con todos sus clientes , todo el esfuerzo que realiza es para poder ayudar económicamente a su familia y aumentar mas herramientas, maquinas y otros para así tener un día una fabrica muy grande y reconocida, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de madera por cantidad, es un joven con muchas ganas de superación agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Max is carpenter who makes furniture and does all kinds of woodwork. At his young age, he has been able to consolidate the quality of his products and obtain a good customer base. He works all week in his workshop in order to deliver the work on the weekends to his customers. All of his hard work is to be able to help his family financially and to buy more tools, machines and more so that his workshop will one day be large and well known. The money from the loan will be used to buy wood in a large quantity. He is a young man who really wants to get ahead and he is grateful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Silvina quién invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Ellas son muy conocidas en el barrio por ser unidas y trabajadoras. Se encuentran actualmente con 12 miembros.
La Sra. Silvina está casada hace 11 años con el señor Adalberto quien trabaja como chofer de una linea de transporte, tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad. Ella tiene una despensa por medio del cual puede ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la casa. Comenta que ya tiene una buena clientela, ya que su vecinos y las personas de loas barrios aledaños vienen a comprar de ella.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, leche, hortalizas, bebidas y demás para el abastecimiento de su establecimiento. Ella tiene como meta ampliar su despensa y  surtir mas sus mercaderias logrando aumentar sus ingresos dentro de su familia,
texts.en:
The contact who started this current committee was Silvina who invited and organized her friends to join the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women's Program.  These ladies are very well known in their neighborhood for being united and hard working.  The group currently has 12 members.

Silvana has been married to Adalberto for 11 years.  He works as a driver for a transport company.  The couple have four grown-up children.  Silvina has a grocery store which enables her to help her husband with their household expenses.  She says that she already has a good customer base since both her neighbors and people from neighboring areas come to buy from her.

Silvana is requesting this loan to buy meat, milk, vegetables, drinks and other products with which to stock her establishment.  Her goal is to expand her grocery store and stock it with more merchandise so that she can increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy milk, meat, vegetables and drinks to stock her store

loans.name: Las Conchitas Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama "Las Conchitas" esta formado por 10 integrantes que son mujeres, el grupo se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Concepcion Chico, la comunidad es algo grande pero esta en un cerro, la carretera principal esta pavimentada pero en épocas de lluvia la arena se empieza a deslavar y es lodo por todos lados. La gente del grupo vive cerca una de otra, entonces son buenos vecinos, y esa fue la razon por la que se reunieron y formaron un grupo de credito, lo llamaron "Las Conchitas" porque son mujures de la comunidad Concepción (de cariño es concha).

La señora Maria es la tesorera del grupo y ella nos cuenta su historia de su negocio, la señora tiene una tienda general, vende dulces, refrescos, pan , leche etc, todo lo referente a una abarroteria, su tienda es pequeña, tambien tiene un molino de Nixtamal, como en las comunidades  acostumbran que para comer las señoras hagan tortillas echas a mano,no compran en una tortilleria, y necesitan un molino que muela el nixtamal para poder hacer la tortilla y doña Maria tiene ese molino para que la gente pueda moler el nixtamal, en su negocio tiene poco mas de 8 años y sus dificultades son la competencia de otras tiendas y algunas gentes que tambien tiene un molino; aparte de esto nos menciona que le han llegado casos en los que le pagan con billetes falsos y ella no se da cuenta y pierde mucho dinero, también debe pagar el mantenimiento o las composturas que podría tener su molino, quiere un credito nuevo para poder pagar el mantenimiento de su molino y comprar mercancia para su tienda y quiere vender cosas nuevas, el proposito que tiene es mejorar dia con dia y comprar unos anaqueles para poder tener su tienda bien arreglada y poder vender mas mercancia, espera poder tener mas ganancias ya que tiene una meta fija y es darles el estudio a sus hijos.

Doña Maria tiene 3 hijos en la escuela y quiere apoyarlos con sus pasajes, vive en union libre con su esposo desde hace 15 años, tiene 43 años de edad, tambien vive con su familia en casa propia y su esposo trabaja, por eso doña Maria lo apoya con lo que gana en su tienda. 
Los nombres de sus demas compañeras del grupo son los siguientes y tambien de sus actividades.
1.-Ana Luisa, tiene un molino de Nixtamal
2.-Valentina, cria y vende borregos
3.-Maria Eleuteria, tiene un molino de nixtamal
4.-Maria Modesta, tiene una tienda general
5.-Rosa, tiene una papeleria
6.-Felipa, cria y vende caballos
7.-Maria Guadalupe, vende jugos frescos
8.-Juana, vende verduras
9.-Nicolasa, cria y vende borregos.
texts.en:
The following group is called “Las Conchitas” and has 10 members, all women.  The group is located in the community of Concepción Chico.  The community is somewhat large but it’s on a hill.  The main road is paved but during the rainy season sand starts to wash off and there is mud everywhere.  People in the group live near each other so are good neighbors and this is the reason they joined together and formed a credit group.  They called it “Las Conchitas” because they are women from the community of Concepción (whose lovable nickname is Concha).

María is the group Treasurer and she relates the story behind her business.  She has a general store where she sells candy, soft-drinks, bread, milk, etc; everything related to groceries.  Her store is small but she also owns a nixtamal (dough made from corn used for tortillas, tamales, etc.) mill.  It’s customary out in the communities for the women to make hand-made tortillas and not to buy them at a tortilla shop.  They need a mill that will grind the corn so that they can make tortillas and María has that mill so that people can grind their corn.  She’s been in business a little more than 8 years and the difficulty she faces is competition from other stores and from individuals who also own mills.  Aside from that, she also mentions that on occasion she’s been paid with counterfeit bills and she doesn’t notice and loses a lot of money.  She also has to pay to service and repair the mill.  She wants a new loan to pay to service the mill and to buy stock items for her store; she wants to sell new products.  Her goal is to improve day to day and to buy some shelving to arrange her store nicely and be able to sell more merchandise.  She hopes to have more profits because her fixed goal is to provide schooling for her children.

María has three children in school and she wants to support them with their transportation costs.  She’s lived with her husband in a common law relationship for the last 15 years.  She’s 43 years old.  She lives with her family in her own house.  Her husband works too and this is why María helps him out with what she earns in the store.

The other group members and their activities are:

1.-Ana Luisa, has a nixtamal mill
2.-Valentina, raises sheep to sell
3.-Maria Eleuteria, has a nixtamal mill
4.-Maria Modesta, has a general store
5.-Rosa, has a stationery shop
6.-Felipa, raises and sells horses
7.-Maria Guadalupe, sells fresh fruit juice
8.-Juana, sells vegetables
9.-Nicolasa, raises and sells sheep.

loans.use: to service a nixtamal mill and to buy merchandise for a general store.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El comité “La Amistad” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Ellas son muy conocidas en el barrio por su trabajo en equipo y la solidaridad que se demuestran las unas con las otras.
La Señora Gregoria es una de las integrantes D. comité, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas, vende por la calle y en los colectivos, es una señora muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. 
Ella tiene  12  hijos y su marido quien trabaja tambien como vendedor ambulante. Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo.
La señora Gregoria solicita el crédito para la compra de más variedad de golosinas y así también poder incorporarle a uno de sus hijos a trabajar con ella.
texts.en:
The "La Amistad" (friendship) group was formed by several neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. The members formed a very united group which is able to work together on activities that strengthen their comradeship. They are very well-known in the neighborhood for their teamwork and the solidarity they all show one another.

Gregoria is one of the group members. She sells sweets on the street and on the buses. She is a very hardworking lady who is very motivated to move ahead. She has 12 children and her husband, who also works as a traveling salesman. She is very satisfied with her work and with the training that the group receives.

Gregoria is asking for the loan to buy a greater variety of sweets, and also to hire one of her children to work with her.

loans.use: to buy sweets for resale later.

loans.name: Michael

texts.es: El joven Michael, es nacido Santa Ana de Yacuma en el Beni, vive en anticrético, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona la Guardia, es de ocupación moto taxista, trabaja, hace unos dos años desde que se dedica a esta labor, el destino del crédito es para terminar de cancelar su moto nueva y trabajarla, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le a brindado ya que esta es su única herramienta de trabajo y con esta actividad mantiene a su familia, es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Michael was born in Santa Ana de Yacuma in El Beni. He lives in a house located in the  La Guardia. He is a motorcycle taxi driver and has done this for two years. The loan is to finish paying for his new motorcycle and to put it to use. He is grateful to the institution for the support it has offered since this is his only work took. With this activity he supports his family. He is a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to finish paying for a motorcycle.

loans.name: Noche Buena Group

texts.es:
La señora María Efrocinia es integrante del grupo "Noche Buena", ella  es casada con el señor Alberto con quien procreo un hijo de nombre Luis Enrique de catorce años de edad.
Ella solicitó el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes, en donde  lleva diez meses  y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen ingreso para su familia ya que su hijo está estudiando y quiere darle lo mas necesario.
Ella se inspiro en esta actividad ya que  también quiere apoyar a su esposo con el ingreso de su hogar, así juntos salir adelante como familia  unida,y para pagar el crédito solicitado.
Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad y el préstamo pueda continuar trabajando para mejorar sus ingresos y así poder apoyar a su hijo  a  que termine su carrera.
Las personas que integran en el grupo son las siguientes: Fabiola Patricia quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración dulces, la señora Betzaida invertirá el préstamo en la compra y venta de ganados y por último la señora Adelina quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para a la elaboración de tamales
texts.en:
Maria Efrocinia is a member of the group "Noche Buena". She is married to Alberto and they have a son named Luis Enrique who is 14 years old.

She asked for a loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients to make breads. She has been doing this for 10 months and tells us that it is going well and has been a good source of income for her family, since her son is studying and she wants to be able to give him what he needs.

She was inspired to start baking because she also wanted to support her husband in bringing income into the home, so they can move ahead together as a united family and pay off their loan.

What she wants more than anything is that with her small business and this loan she will be able to continue working to increase her income and be able to support her son until he finishes school.

The members of the group are: Fabiola Patricia, who will invest in ingredients for making candies; Betzaida, who will invest in the purchase and sale of cattle; and finally Adelina, who will invest the loan in ingredients to make tamales.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es: La Sra. Mary, vive en el domicilio de su tía  zona la guardia,  es nacida en Santa Cruz- Florida, es madre soltera y tiene una hija, es comerciante de ropa,  trabaja como ambulante, hace unos ocho meses se dedica a esta labor, además trabaja de profesora de una guardería ubicada cerca de su casa, el destino del crédito es para comprar mercadería como ropa de invierno ya que esta haciendo mucho frio y sus clientes le pidieron chompas chamarras y bufandas, ella es una persona trabajadora que sola saca adelante a su hija, con deseos de mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su hija se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Mary lives in her aunt's home in La Guardia.  She was born in Santa Cruz- Florida.  Mary is a single mother and has one daughter.  She sells clothes as an itinerant vendor.  She has been in this business for eight months.  She also works as a teacher at a nursery school near her home.

Mary will use her loan to buy merchandise such as winter clothes as it is very cold and her customers have asked her for sweaters, jackets and scarves.  Mary is a hard-working person who is bringing up her daughter alone.  She has a great desire to improve her own quality of life and that of her daughter.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes

loans.name: Virgen Del Perpetuo Socorro Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Paraguarí se reúnen 13 mujeres, dentro del comité denominado Virgen del perpetuo Socorro. Ellas se unieron tras escuchar hablar del programa de mujeres emprendedoras. Todas son conocidas en el barrio y alrededores por su forma de trabajar. Su objetivo común es generar mas ingresos para darle un mejor estilo de vida a sus familias.
La Sra Anselma se dedica a la venta de hortalizas. Comenta que este trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que todos los días ella se levanta a muy tempranas horas para poder comprar las verduras que va a vender. Dice que todo lo que hace es por el bien de su familia, ya que le gustaría poder darles un estilo de vida diferente, es decir, sin privaciones.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hortalizas de todo tipo para luego venderlas, Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le da la Fundación, pues sabe que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Thirteen women who form the committee called “Virgen del Perpetuo Socorro” (Our Lady of Perpetual Help) meet in the city of Paraguarí.  They came together after hearing talk about the enterprising women’s program.  They are all known in the neighborhood and surrounding areas for their way of working.  Their common objective is to generate more income to provide their families with better lifestyles.

Anselma sells vegetables.  She comments that this is very demanding work since she rises early every day to be able to buy the vegetables she will sell.  She says that everything she does is for her family’s wellbeing because she’d like to give them a different lifestyle, that is to say, one without deprivations.

She requests the loan to buy all types of vegetables to later resell.  She is very grateful for the opportunity the Fundación grants her because she knows that the loan will be of much help to her.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Las Chispitas Group

texts.es:
El  grupo se llama Flor de mayo, y se ubica en la localidad de Julián Grajales, se integra de cuatro señoras quien cada uno tiene  diferente actividad.
La señora quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama Carmela, ella es casada, con el señor  Agustín  y con quien procreo cinco hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad y son: Jorge Rodolfo  de  veintidós  años de edad, Armando  de veintiun años de edad, Rafael de dieciocho años de  edad, Dionisia de de diecisiete años de edad y el mas pequeño es Alejandro de ocho años de edad.
Ella se dedica a  la compra y venta de frutas y legumbres en donde  lleva  seis meses  trabajando con ello y comenta que le va bien ya que está  teniendo un buen ingreso y a mejorado su calidad de vida ya que su esposo la apoya con la produccion de algunas verduras y  pero aun así solicito el préstamo para comprar otras que le hacen falta en su negocio.
Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó por su propia creatividad ya que en su rancho su esposo siembra chayotes, chipilín, rábanos, entre otros y decidió venderlos para así apoyarse con un poco mas de dinero  y dárselo a su hijos que estudian en otro estado de la Republica Mexicana (Veracruz).
Lo que más desea es que con el préstamo y  su actividad pueda  trabajar más para poder ahorrar y  así seguirá apoyando a sus hijos a que terminen una carrera.
La señora que integra el grupo son las siguientes: Mirna quien invierte el préstamo en la compra de material para la elaboración de block, la señora Esperanza invertirá el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, Aurora  en la compra de de refrescos.
texts.en:
The group is called Flor de Mayo and is located in Julian Grajales. It is made up of 4 women who each do different activities. The woman who was interviewed is Carmela. She is married to Agustin and they have 5 children who are still dependent on them: Jorge Rodolfo, 22; Armando, 21; Rafael, 18, Dionisia, 17; and the youngest is Alejandro, 8. 

Carmela buys and sells fruits and vegetables. She has been doing this for 6 months and says that it's going well and is bringing good income and has improved her quality of life. Her husband supports her by growing some vegetables, but even so she needs a loan to buy others that she lacks.

Her inspiration for this business began as a result of her own creativity. Her husband plants chayote, chipilin, radishes and other things and she decided to sell them so that she could support herself with a little more money and give it to her sons who study in another state in Mexico (Veracruz). 

What she wants most is that with this loan and her business she will be able to work more and be able to save money so that she can continue supporting her sons until they finish school.

The other members of the group are: Mirna, who will buy materials to make cinder-block; Esperanza, who will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store; and Aura, who will buy sodas.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La Sra. Betty pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas II” del Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento D. San Martín. Está casada, tiene 41 años y tiene 03 hijos en edad escolar.

Empezó vendiendo jugo D. naranja y toronja por las mañanas y como vio que las ganancias no eran suficiente para sus gastos familiares pensó en otro negocio. Con un capital D. S/.300.00 y el apoyo D. su esposo compró un carrito salchipapero (comida al paso) para que venda por las noches, así poco a poco fue ganando clientela. Actualmente continúa vendiendo jugos D. frutas D. la región y por las noches venD. “salchipapas” y otras variedades como “pollo broster” y “salchipan”, además refrescos y gaseosas.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2500.00 comprará  productos e ingredientes al por mayor D. esa manera disminuirá sus costos, comprará papas por sacos, aceite por galones y condimentos, además comprará envases descartables que utiliza en su negocio. 

Betty es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora,  su sueño es tener un negocio en su propia casa vendiendo sus productos y dedicarse además a otros negocios que le permitan crecer y mejorar económicamente, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad D. continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Betty is a member of the "Las Golondrinas II' (Swallows II) community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martín province and department.  She is 41 years old, married, and has three school-age children.

Betty started out selling orange and grapefruit juice in the mornings.  She saw that the profits she was making were not enough to cover her family expenses and so decided to start another business.  With 300 Peruvian soles in capital, and the support of her husband, she bought a cart for selling 'salchipapas' (Peruvian fast food).  She would make her sales in the evenings and gradually acquired customers.  She currently continues selling juices maD. from regional fruits and, in the evenings, she sells 'salchipapas' and other food such as fried chicken and 'salchipan' as well as soft drinks and soda.

Betty will use this loan for 2,500 soles to buy products and ingredients wholesale.  In this way, she will reduce her costs.  She will buy potatoes by the sack, oil by the gallon, and herbs and spices.  She will also buy disposable containers that she uses in her business.

Betty is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  Her dream is to have a business in her own home, selling her products.  She would also like to have other businesses that would allow her to grow and improve her financial situation.  She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for having given her the opportunity to continue in her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit, potatoes, oil and disposable containers

loans.name: Cañaveral Group

texts.es:
El comité Cañaveral, es de la ciudad de Lambaré, cuenta actualmente con 12 miembros. Todas ellas trabajan muy unidas y contentas dentro del programa. Se unieron con el objetivo de crecer no solo económicamente sino también como persona, por medio del trabajo conjunto con las demás integrantes.
Las señoras integrantes del comité se destacan por el sacrificio y las ganas de progresar, muchas de ellas madres solteras que inician su día a día desde muy tempranas horas trayendo sus productos a la ciudad de Asunción; capital del Paraguay, para la venta.
La Sra. Marciana se dedica a la venta de ropas de segunda mano. Comenta que tiene muchas ventas, en especial en esta época de frío que se viene, ya que las personas demandan mucho los abrigos. Ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, siempre trabajo, y por medio de ese trabajo que realiza puede salir adelante con su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas de invierno para poder cumplir de esa forma con la demanda de sus clientes. Esta muy esperanzada en el crédito ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The “Cañaveral” (sugar cane plantation) committee is from the city of Lambaré and currently has 12 members.  All of them work very united and happy within the program.  They came together with the objective of growing not only economically but also as people though teamwork with the other members.

The women who form the committee stand out for their sacrifice and their desire to make progress.  Many of them are single mothers who start their days from very early hours bringing their products to the city of Asunción, capital of Paraguay, to be sold.

Marciana sells second hand clothes. She comments that she has many sales, especially during the cold season that’s approaching because people ask for coats a lot.  She considers herself to be very hard working and tenacious, always working, and through this work she realizes that she can get ahead with her family.

She asks for the loan to buy winter clothes to meet customer demand.  She is very hopeful with the loan because it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes.

loans.name: Nicolas De Jesus

texts.es: Nicolás De Jesús tiene 42 años, el negocio lo inicio por sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar por cuenta propia. Su actividad es la venta de ropa y cosméticos, a diario vende cierta cantidad de productos, porque la mayoría de sus clientes ya conocen la buena calidad de ropa que ofrece, también la manera acogedora de atender al público. Por eso, quiere incrementar más su negocio, con productos mejor calidad es por eso que recurre a este crédito con el que comprara pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, vestidos y otras cosas. Además le agrada esta actividad que tiene pues es por medio de su negocio que ha sacado adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Nicolás De Jesús is 42 years old.   He started the business thanks to his parents who taught him how to work on his own.  His activity is the sale of clothes and cosmetics.  He sells certain amounts of products every day because most of his customers already know the good quality of clothes he offers as well as the welcoming way he tends to the public.  

Because of this he’d like to increase business with better quality products so he is resorting to this loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, dresses and others.  Besides, he enjoys the work he does because through the business he’s been able to move his family forward.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Gloria Bernice

texts.es:
La Sra. Gloria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Brigada Ramírez” del Distrito y Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 47 años, está Casada y tiene 02 hijos que están estudiando en el nivel superior.

Una amiga le pidió que le diera pensión (alimentos) y ella vio la oportunidad de iniciar un negocio propio y ser independiente económicamente, su amiga le recomendó otros clientes y así empezó la venta de comida en su propia casa, actualmente no solo da pensión sino también vende al público en general. Sus clientes la prefieren por su sazón y buen trato que les brinda.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00,  comprará productos al por mayor e ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas como arroz y azúcar por sacos, aceite, menestras.
 
Gloria  es una mujer trabajadora y creativa,  su sueño es contar con un nuevo negocio de venta de abarrotes que le permita crecer económicamente, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad, a mujeres como ella, de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the “Brigada Ramírez” community bank which is located in Lamas district and province, in San Martín department.  She is 47 years old, married, and has two children who are in college.

A friend asked Gloria to provide her with bed and board and she saw an opportunity to start her own business and become financially independent.  Her friend recommended her to other customers and she thereby started selling food in her own home.  She now not only provides bed and board but also sells food to the general public.  Her customers prefer to buy from her because of the good flavor of her food and the good customer service that she provides.

Gloria will use this loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles to buy products and ingredients wholesale for preparing her food such as rice and sugar by the sack, oil and vegetables.

Gloria is a hard-working and creative woman.  Her dream is to own another business selling groceries which will enable her to grow financially.  She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for providing women such as herself with the opportunity to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, meat and groceries to prepare her food

loans.name: Yeni Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yeni del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de sombreros artesanales y chinelas entre otros productos. Este negocio lo inicio  hace ocho años con unos ahorros. 
Además ella tiene una fritanga restaurante popular a base de comida frita donde vende  aproximadamente 7, 500 semanales de  enchiladas, tajadas con queso, tacos, carne asada….etc. 
La meta de Yeni es tener su propio tramo ya que ella vende de manera ambulante en el mercado de Masaya.
texts.en:
Yeni del Carmen is a hard-working, courageous, and enterprising woman.  She works making handcrafted hats, slippers, and other products.  She started this business eight years ago with her savings.

She also has a popular restaurant that sells fried foods.  Every week, she sells about 7,500 enchiladas, cheese slices, tacos, and roasted meat.  

Yeni's goal is to have her own stall, because she currently sells on foot at the market in Masaya.

loans.use: to make hats and slippers, and with her fried food restaurant.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
La señora Nora es socia del banco comunal Lideres Triunfadoras del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 54 años de edad, es viuda y tiene cinco hijos mayores de edad.
Con su primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos compró su primera máquina de coser.
Lleva cinco años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la confección de vestidos a medida, cuenta con un pequeño taller instalado en su casa y dos máquinas que le ayudan a dar un buen acabado a las prendas que confecciona.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 8 cortes de tela, 5 metros de tela para toallas, 4 metros de tela para pantalón, ¼ de ciento de cierres, botones diferentes tamaños y modelos.
Solo uno de sus hijos esta a su cargo, se da tiempo para atender los quehaceres del hogar y a su hijo, solo cuando tiene mucho trabajo esta todo el día en su máquina y tiene que ir a comer a la calle para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
Para ayudar a su hijo seguirá trabajando hasta que su hijo pueda terminar una carrera.  Está muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de mejorar su vida y la de su hijo que en estos momentos 
tanto la necesita.
texts.en:
Nora is a member of the “Lideres Triunfadoras” (Triumphant Leaders) Communal Bank of the Calleria district in Ucayali department. She is 54 years old, a widow, and has 5 adult children.

With her 1st loan from Manuela Ramos she bought her 1st sewing machine. Nora has collaborated with Manuela Ramos for 5 years, sewing custom-made dresses. She has a small shop installed in her house and 2 machines to help her give a good finish to the items of clothing she makes.

With her new loan of 2,500 new sols, she will buy 8 bales of cloth, 5 meters of towel cloth, 4 meters of cloth for pants, ¼ of a hundred of zippers, and buttons of different sizes and models.

Only 1 of Nora's children is still under her care, and she needs time to attend to household matters and her son. Only when she has a lot of work does she spend all day at her machine and goes out into the street to eat, to manage to complete her customer's orders.

To help her son, she will continue working until he finishes his career education. Nora is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing this opportunity to improve her life and that of her son, which in these moments she greatly needs.

loans.use: to buy cloth and other supplies at wholesale for dressmaking.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: La Sra. Mónica, vive en el domicilio alquilado ubicado en la zona la guardia,  es nacida en Santa Ana de Yacuma - Beni, es soltera  es comerciante de ropa y cosméticos vende cosméticos por catalogo ofreciendo oficina por oficina,  trabaja como ambulante, hace unos dos años y medio se dedica a esta labor, el destino del crédito es para comprar mercadería de cosméticos que se encuentran en promoción y así ella obtener un poco mas de ganancia, es una persona joven con ganas de superación,  se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que se le a brindado.
texts.en:
Mónica lives in a rented house located in the La Guardia area.  She was born in Santa Ana de Yacuma - Beni.  She is single and she works selling clothing and cosmetics.  She sells cosmetics from catalogs, walking from office to office.  She has done this work for two and a half years.

She is asking for this loan to purchase cosmetics products that are on promotion, so that she can earn more income.  She is a young person with a desire to get ahead.  She is thankful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics products that are on promotion.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
En Ciudad del Este se reúnen 19 mujeres para la formación del comité denominado Mujeres Unidas. Todas ellas son mujeres jefas de familias, que luchan por el sustento diario. Se unieron con un fin en común que es la lucha en conjunto por la obtención de mayores beneficios de todas las miembros. Todas son conocidas en el barrio por la excelente labor que realizan.
La Sra. Amalia es manicurista, por medio de su profesión ella ha podido salir adelante, generando mayores ingresos para el sustento de su hogar. Ella comenta que tienen ya un grupo de clientas bien definido que siempre la llaman para hacerles algún trabajo. Dice que los fines de semana es cuando tiene mayor trabajo, debido a que en esos días donde la gente va a fiestas y eventos. Sueña con algún día poder tener su propia peluquería.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de esmaltes, corta cutículas u otros insumos que necesite para realizar su trabajo. Desde ya agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le está dando.
texts.en:
In Ciudad del Este, 19 women meet to form the group Mujeres Unidas.  All are heads of their families that fight for daily sustenance.   They come together to fight for a common goal, to obtain greater profits for all the members.  They are all known in their neighborhood for their excellent work.  

Señora Amalia is a manicurist and through this profession she has been able get ahead, generating a higher income to support her household.  She says that she has a group of established customers that always call her to do work for them.  She also says that the weekends are when she has the most work because those are the days when people go to parties and events.  She dreams that some day she will have her own shop.  

She is requesting a loan to buy polish, cuticle scissors and other supplies that she needs to do her job.  She is grateful to Fundación for the opportunity they are giving her.

loans.use: purchase polish, cuticle scissors, and other supplies that she needs for her job as a manicurist.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Luis de oficio carpintero, con 31 años de edad, casado y con dos hijos. Inicia a la edad de 16 años con capital propio realizando trabajos menores a personas particulares y haciendo mesas pequeñas, las cuales comerccializaba en la ciudad de Sebaco, con la ayuda de un familiar, contando en ese entonces solamente con esos ingresos. Luis, solicitó su crédito para incrementar su capital de trabajo,compra de materia como madera  , tornillo,pegamento para elaboracion de muebles el cual le ayudará a tener mejores ingresos y por la tanto asi mejorar su calidad de vida para él y su familia. Los planes futuros son incrementar su negocio y sub contratar a dos personas que le ayuden a elaborar e impulsar sus productos.
texts.en:
Luis, 31, is married, has two children and is a carpinter by trade.  He started his business with his own money when he was 16, and used to do jobs such as making small tables for people.  He sold them throughout the city of Sebaco with help from a relative, and that was his only source of income.

Luis has requested a loan to increase his working capital so he can buy wood, glue and screws to make furniture.  This will help him increase his income and improve his family's lifestyle.  In the future he would like to expand his business and hire two workers to help him make and market his products.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as wood, glue and screws.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La señora Agripina es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y con buenas referencias personales quien desde hace 15 años trabaja como responsable de bodega del Ministerio de Salud. Este es su tercer crédito con Adim para mejora de vivienda la cual va realizando poco a poco.
Ella con este préstamo mejorará su casa en especial el techo que está muy deteriorado, con muchas goteras y sarro.
texts.en:
Señora Agripina is a hard-working woman, enterprising and with good personal references.  For the last 15 years, she has been working as head of the warehouse at the Ministry of Health.  This is her third loan through Adim to improve her home, which is slowly taking place.

With this loan, she will improve her home.  In particular, the roof is badly damaged, with many leaks and scale.

loans.use: to fix her roof

loans.name: Olga M.

texts.es:
La señora Olga es socia del banco comunal Lideres Triunfadoras del Distrito D. Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 55 años D. edad, es madre soltera y tiene seis hijos mayores D. edad (solo 1 depenD. D. ella)
Su primer gran proyecto D. negocio lo inicio con el dinero que le dío Manuela Ramos. Ella se dedica a la venta D. refrescos y bebidas gaseosas, la venta D. sus refrescos la realiza fuera D. su casa, aprovecha los eventos que es cuando se reune más gente y venD. más.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, comprará un motor D. refrigeradora, pagará el servicio del técnico que reparó la refrigeradora, comprará 1 saco D. azúcar, ½ kilo D. canela, ½ kilo D. clavo D. olor, 2 cientos D. vasos descartables.
Solo le queda un hijo a su cargo y por eso tiene que trabajar para poder apoyarlo económicamente para que termine sus estudios, sus demás hijos ya tiene sus familias y son profesionales.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por los préstamos otorgados a su persona, para seguir trabajando.  Todavía tiene muchas cosas por realizar.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the community bank Lideres Triunfadoras, located in the Calleria district in the department of Ucayali.  She is 55 years old and is a single mother to six adult children (only one is dependent on her).  

She started her first big business project with money from Manuela Ramos.  She works selling soft drinks and carbonated beverages.  She sells drinks outsiD. her home.  She likes events, because more people gather and she sells more. 

With this new loan of 3000 nuevos soles, she will purchase a refrigerator motor, pay the technician who fixes the refrigerator, and purchase one sack of sugar, 1/2 kilo of cinnamon, 1/2 kilo of cloves, and 200 disposable cups.  

She only has one child left in her care, and she works hard to support them financially so they can finish school.  Her other children already have their own families and jobs.

She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for the loans they have provided her so that she can continue working.  She still has many things she wants to accomplish.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, supplies, and a refrigerator motor.

loans.name: Obertila

texts.es:
La señora Obertila es socia del banco comunal Líderes triunfadoras del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 51 años D. edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos independientes.  Con su primer préstamo y en sociedad, empezó a trabajar porque el negocio requería D. mayor inversión.. 
En el tiempo que lleva trabajando con Manuela Ramos ha tenido la oportunidad D. hacer distintos negocios, sola o en sociedad, pero ahora se dedica a las confecciones D. prendas D. vestir y lencería. No tiene socio alguno.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 7 metros D. algodón, 1 rollo D. elástico para pierna, 1 rollo D. elástico para cintura, 4 hilos D. remalle, 2 paños D. aguja para maquina, 1 paño D. aguja para remalladora.
Ahora solo se dedica a la costura y lo hace en su casa, solo tiene que atender a su esposo que es con quien vive y comparte los gastos del hogar, ya sus hijos sonindependientes y sus nietos los visitan los sábados que es cuando se dedica todo el día  a ellos.
texts.en:
Señora Obertila is a member of the community bank "Líderes Triunfadoras " ("Triumphant Leaders"), which is in the Calleria District in the Department of Ucayali.  She is 51 years old, and is married with two independent children.  She took her first loan as part of a partnership because her business required more investment.

In the time she has been working with Manuela Ramos, she has had the opportunity to work in various businesses, alone or in partnership, but now she works making apparel and lingerie.  She does not have any partner in this business.

With her new loan of 3000 New Soles, she will buy 7 meters of cotton, 1 roll of elastic for legs, 1 roll elastic for waists, 4 spools of thread, 2 sleeves of needles for the machine, 1 sleeve of sewing needles.

Now she only works on sewing and does it from home.  She only needs to look after her husband, with whom she lives and shares household expenses.  Their children and grandchildren are independent, and visit them on Saturdays, when she spends all day with them.

loans.use: to buy cotton, elastic, needles, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Trabajadoras se inicio a causa de que una de las integrantes del grupo es hermana de otra señora que integra otro comité dentro de la ciudad de Luque, ella decide invitar a sus vecinas y amigas a conformar un nuevo comité en su barrio. Actualmente se encuentra en el décimo primer ciclo del programa de Comité de Mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya. Esta conformado por 19 señoras que trabajan de forma responsable y dentro de un ambiente de cooperación.
La señora Jorgelina, esta acompañada con el señor Raúl, juntos tienen dos hijas, una de seis años quien va al primer grado y la otra de un año de edad. Jorgelina se dedica a la venta de ropas, anteriormente se trabajaba como empleada domestica. Comenta que en la venta de ropa le va muy bien, puesto que ya tiene una clientela formada. Le gusta poder ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la casa, ya que si el esfuerzo es compartido se pueden sobrellevar mejor los gastos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas de invierno, lo cual le será muy beneficioso ya que tiene muchas demandas de clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
The “Comité Mujeres Trabajadoras” began because one of the members of the group’s sister is a member of a different committee within the city of Luque and decided to invite her friends and neighbors to create a new group in the neighborhood.  It’s currently in the eleventh cycle of the “Comité Mujeres Trabajadoras” of the “Fundación Paraguaya.”  It’s made up of 19 ladies who work responsibly in an air of mutual cooperation.

Jorgelina is married to Raúl.  Together they have two daughters, one is six years old and in the first grade, and the other is one year old.  Jorgelina sells clothing.  She used to work as a housekeeper and says that clothing sales has gone well for her and that she has steady customers.  She likes being able to help her husband with the household expenses because if they pool their efforts they can better pay their expenses.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy winter clothing, which will be very helpful because she has good customer demand.  She appreciates the Foundation for the opportunity that it gives her.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es: "En 5 años me veo trabajando en una empresa donde voy a adquirir experiencia laboral y tratar de superarme cada día que pase para ser un buen profesional. Me inspira mi familia porque ellos me han brindado todo el apoyo para que yo salga adelante y trate de superarme. Me destaco de los demás por el interés que tengo en sacar mi título y comenzar a trabajar lo más pronto posible. El desafío más grande ha sido el obtener mi título ya que se me ha hecho muy difícil por la falta de dinero para pagar la titulación, pero Gracias a Dios he tocado muchas puertas que me han ayudado para que cumpla mi objetivo"
texts.en: “In 5 years I'll be working in an enterprise where I'll acquire work experience and I'll try to advance myself every day to become a good professional. I'm inspired by my family because they have offered me every kind of help so that I can get ahead and attempt to advance myself. I stand out compared to the rest by my interest in receiving my title and commencing work as soon as possible.  The greatest challenge has been to obtain my title, since the lack of money to pay the title fees has made it very difficult. But, thanks to God, I have knocked on many doors where I have received help in reaching my objective.”

loans.use: to pay the fees for receiving her career diploma in the university.

loans.name: Maria Petita

texts.es:
Maria de 50 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un salón de belleza donde trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano atendiendo a sus clientes fijos. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso trabaja desde las 08h30am hasta las 20h00pm. 

Trabaja cortando, tinturado cabellos, manicuri, pedicuri etc. Gracias a los estudios de belleza que hizo en su juventud, ahora tiene su propio negocio. Tiene muchas aspiración en su negocio por eso quiere trabajar con mucho esfuerzo para su negocio y su familia. Con el préstamo quiere comprar herramientas para su salón de belleza como planchas, secadoras etc. En el futuro quiere expandir su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who owns a beauty salon where she works every day, from very early in the morning, serving her regular customers.  She has many aspirations for her business and so she works from 8.30am to 8.00pm.

Maria works cutting and dying hair, giving manicures and pedicures, etc.  Thanks to the beauty courses that she took in her youth, she now owns her own business.  She has many aspirations for her business and so would like to work very hard for her business and her family.  She would like to use this loan to buy tools for her beauty salon such as hair irons, dryers, etc.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her income so that she can provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy hair irons and dryers

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana María es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien hace 8 años inicio con la venta de chiverías, helados, gaseosas…etc. con las ganancias lo fue surtiendo y aumentando. En la actualidad ella vende semanal aproximadamente 14, 000 córdobas.
Ella con el crédito compra arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, queso, pan, gaseosa…etc. entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Ana María is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who, eight years ago, started selling snacks, iced treats, soda, etc.  She used her profits to stock and increase her business.  She currently sells approximately 14,000 cordobas worth of stock a week.  

Ana María will use her loan to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, cheese, bread, soda and other products.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, cheese, bread, soda, etc.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
La Sra. Magaly pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del 2000” del Distrito y Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 01 hija que está estudiando en el nivel inicial.

Se inició vendiendo productos de belleza por catálogo y ante la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos y contando con un capital de S/.300.00 decidió vender ropa para todas las edades, zapatos y otros artículos como regalos, los mismos que ofrecía entre sus amistades.
Actualmente a acondicionado, en su casa, un ambiente para exhibir sus productos pues tiene algunos mostradores y vitrinas, lo que le permite captar a nuevos clientes que pasen por su local, además siempre está en la búsqueda de novedades de productos para dar diferentes opciones a sus clientes fijos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00,  comprará  ropa para niños y adultos, zapatos y regalos para implementar su negocio, algunos de ellos son pedidos y otros son para implementar más su negocio.
 
Magaly es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, su sueño es contar con un negocio que vaya creciendo y le permita mejorar sus ganancias.  Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella y así poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Magaly belongs to the “Mujeres del 2000” community bank which is located in Lamas district and province.  She is 33 years old, lives with her partner, and has one daughter who is in elementary school.

Magaly started out selling beauty products through a catalog.  Faced with the need to make her own income, and with 300 Peruvian soles worth of capital, she decided to start selling clothes for all ages, shoes and other items such as gifts.  She sold these products to her friends.

Magaly now has an area set up in her home where she can display her products as she has some counters and display cabinets.  This enables her to gain new customers who pass by her premises.  She is also always on the lookout for new products so that she can provide her regular customers with different options.

Magaly will use this loan for 3,000 soles to buy children's and adults' clothes, shoes and gifts to stock her business.  Some of them will be used to fill orders and others will be used to further stock her business.

Magaly is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  Her dream is to own a business that will grow and enable her to improve her profits.  She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for providing women such as her with the opportunity to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and gifts

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El Sr. Julio Cesar tiene 32años vive en la ciudad de Concepción, esta casado con la señora Silveria tienen  dos hijos, una nena que tiene dos años y el varón tiene seis años el cual va en la escuela primaria de Belén.
El señor Julio hace mas de quince años trabaja en la mecánica, comenzó como ayudante y mas tarde comenzaron a instalar su propio taller en conjunto con un socio en la casa de su suegro, pero en la actualidad su socio ya se retiro hace mas de dos años y se quedó él como dueño único del taller que todavía esta funcionando en la casa de su suegro. 
Don Julio vive con su señora y sus hijos en su propia casa hace 8 meses que por cierto todavía no esta del todo terminado. Unos de sus sueños es trasladar su taller en su propio domicilio y cuando apenas termine bien su casa lo va a hacer.
El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas para utilizar dentro de su taller mecánico. Él está muy agradecido a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 32 years old and lives in the city of Concepción.  He’s married to Silveria and they have two children, a two year old girl and a six year old son who attends the elementary school in Belén.

Julio has been working as a mechanic for more than 15 years.  He began as an assistant and later he and a partner began setting up their own shop at his father-in-law’s house.  His partner retired two years ago and he became the sole proprietor of the shop, which is still at his father-in-law’s house.

Julio has been living with his wife and two children in his own home for eight months but not everything is finished.  One of his dreams is to move his shop to his own home and he will do so when his house is finished.

He is asking for this loan in order to buy tools for his shop.  He is very grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity it provides him.

loans.use: to buy tools for his shop.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: Gregoria tiene 38 años, vive con su  esposo y 4 de sus 7 hijos en casa de su suegra Gregoria y su esposo heredaron tierras, de las cuales lo está utilizando para sus actividades agrarias. Es así que en dichos terrenos siembra maíz, siendo un producto muy importante, pues la desgranarlo y secarlo se convierte granos que tienen mucha demanda en el mercado de su localidad. Siempre ha procurado vender lo que produce de manera directa ya que esto le genera mayores ganancias. Su esposo y sus hijos también la poyan en estas tareas porque es una actividad familiar que los fortalece y consolida. Sin embargo su esposo también tiene otro trabajo como maestro de obra, pero de manera paralela tiene su granja de cuyes  que también vende de manera periódica. De esta manera es como siguen adelante, ya que su fin es terminar de construir su casa para acondicionar un espacio granja donde pueda  tener su granja de cuyes tener más extensiones de terreno. Son varias ocasiones en las que viene trabajando con MFP, considera que los créditos grupales son una  oportunidad de desarrollo y  pude probarlo con su propia experiencia  por la cual siempre recomienda a otras personas. Con el dinero que solicita,  le servirá para comprar sacos de abono orgánico para sembrar maíz.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 38 years old and lives with her husband, and four of her seven children, in her mother-in-law's house.

Gregoria and her husband inherited land which they are farming.  On the land, Gregoria grows corn which is a very important product.  She removes the kernels and dries them.  In this state they are very much in demand her town market.  Gregoria has always tried to sell what she produces directly as this makes her more profits.  Her husband and children support her in her work because it is a family activity which strengthens their family unit.  However, her husband also has another job as a master builder.  In addition, they have a guinea pig farm and they also periodically sell their guinea pigs.  In this way, the family gets ahead.  Gregoria's goal is to finish building her home so that she can set aside a large space so that she can expand her guinea pig farm.  

Gregoria has worked with MFP on several occasions.  She considers group loans to be an opportunity to develop.  She has experienced this for herself and always recommends it to other people.  She will use the money she has requested to buy sacks of organic manure for growing her corn.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Leyli

texts.es:
La señora Leyli, es socia del banco comunal Lideres Triunfadoras de Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, está casada, tiene 44 años de edad y dos hijos menores de edad.
Tener su primer préstamo le dió las ganas de hacer lo que siempre había pensado, pero no contaba con capital.
Es socia fundadora de su banco comunal, tiene una bodega instalada en su casa y no interfiere con la atención de su casa y de sus hijos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 docena de fruta al jugo, ½ caja de conservas, 1 paquete de fideo, 1 caja de galleta, 1 caja de leche, 1 bolsa de harina, 1 caja de cocoa, 2 tiras de nescafe, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 1 caja de aceite.
Con este negocio puede ayudar con algunos gastos en la casa, su esposo es maestro de obras y es quien mantiene el hogar, debido a su trabajo a veces tiene que ausentarse casi todo el día, ella tiene que hacerse cargo de todo.
texts.en:
Leyli is a member of the 'Líderes Triunfadoras' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 44 years old, married, and has two dependent children.  Her first loan gave her the will to do what she had always planned to do but didn't have enough capital for.

Leyli is a founding member of her community bank.  She has a grocery store in her home.  This allows her to look after her home and her children as well.

Leyli will use her new loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles to buy one dozen lots of fruit juice, 1/2 a crate of canned goods, 1 packet of noodles, 1 box of cookies, 1 crate of milk, 1 bag of flour, 1 box of cocoa, 2 strips of Nescafe sachets, 1 sack of sugar, 1 sack of rice and 1 crate of oil.

Through her business, Leyli is able to help with some of her household expenses.  Her husband is a master builder and he supports their household.  As a result of his work, he sometimes has to disappear for almost the whole day and Leyli has to take care of everything.

loans.use: to buy milk, juice, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
La señora Daniela  tiene 42 años, es soltera, vive en su propia casa en la Ciudad de Caacupé, la misma se dedica la producción de queso y venta de leche.
Comenta que debido al tiempo que lleva en este ramo cuenta con clientela formada. Ella es muy conocida en el barrio y las zonas próximas por la excelente calidad de sus productos, ya sea el queso o la leche. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, ya que el trabajo que realiza es muy pesado y requiere de mucho esfuerzo, no solo físico, sino también mental.
La Señora solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca preñada, ya que con esto aumentara su producción y podrá satisfacer la demanda de su clientela, esto le permitirá obtener más ingresos a su unidad familiar. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le está dando.
texts.en:
Señora Daniela  is 42 years old, single, and lives in her own house in the city of Caacupé.  She makes cheese and sells milk for a living.  She says that due to length of time she has been in this field she has an established clientele.  She is very well-known in her neighborhood and the nearby regions for the excellent quality of her products.  She is known as a hard-working woman since the work that she does is very difficult and requires a lot of effort, not only physical, but also mental.  

She is requesting a loan to buy a pregnant cow as this will increase her production and she will be able to satisfy her customer's demands.  She will also be able to obtain more income for her household.  She is grateful to Fundación for the opportunity they are giving her.

loans.use: purchase a pregnant cow to increase her milk production.

loans.name: Yahosca

texts.es: La señora Yahoska es una fémina trabajadora y emprendedora originaria de Masaya ciudad de las flores. Ella se dedica a la venta de  perecederos desde hace 13 años principalmente plátanos y papayas en los cuales invertirá el crédito con la compra de una camionada de plátanos y papayas.
texts.en: Yahoska is a hardworking, enterprising woman from Masaya, the city of flowers.  She has been selling perishable items for the past 13 years, mainly bananas and papayas.  She will use the money from this loan to buy a truckload of bananas and papayas.

loans.use: to buy a truckload of fruit.

loans.name: Lesfia María

texts.es:
En el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y además visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Para  Superar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lesfia, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes. El marido trabaja en una bananera. Está en el Grupo De Crédito por 8 ciclos, es la presidenta del grupo y le gusta porque todas sus compañeras son muy ordenadas y cumplidas.

Ella se gana un dinero extra vendiendo comidas rápidas, para lo cual cuenta con una carreta que es donde vende los alimentos, ella vende hamburguesas, hot dog y también arroz con menestra y carne asada, esto lo realiza de lunes a jueves ya que el viernes muy de mañana se desplaza  a las playas de Manta con la finalidad de adquirir mariscos que luego lleva a entregar a otras ciudades, nos cuenta que cada semana se desplaza a ciudades distintas en el cual entrega sus productos y se queda en ella todo el fin de semana ya que entrega y después realiza los cobros respectivos. Lleva 9 años que se dedica a la venta de comida y 6 meses a la venta de mariscos y le está yendo muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pan, salchichas, carne, pescado, camarón, etc. tanto para preparar los alimentos como para la venta.

Sus sueños son tener un carro ya que hasta ahora se traslada en carros de cooperativa y esto es muy complicado.
texts.en:
The beautiful resort area of San Jacinto is surrounded by a beautiful beach, a place where the Portoviejo River converges with the sea.  It is visited by many national and foreign tourists.  “The Esperanza Para Superar” communal bank meets here every two weeks.

Here we meet Lesfia.  She is 40 years old, has three adult children, and her husband works for a banana plantation.  She is the president of her group and has been a member for eight loan cycles.  She likes the group because all of her fellow members are organized and keep their promises.

She earns extra money making fast food and has a cart from where she sells her foods, such as hamburgers, hot dogs, and stew with rice and grilled meat.  She does this Monday through Thursday and also goes to Manta beach early in the morning to buy seafood to deliver to other cities.  She tells us that each week she goes to different cities to deliver her products and stays there all weekend because she makes her deliveries and respective collections.  She’s been selling food for nine years and seafood for six months and things are going well.

She will use the money from this loan to buy bread, hot dogs, meat, fish, shrimp, etc., both for preparing her dishes and to sell.

She hopes to get a car of her own because she currently uses co-op cars and it make things more difficult.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Rosa Petith

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Brigada Ramírez” del Distrito y Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es separada, tiene 54 años y solo vive con su hija, todos los demás son independientes y ya han conformado sus hogares.

Decidió dedicarse a un negocio pues por aquel tiempo su pareja no la apoyaba económicamente y tenía la necesidad de mantener a la última de sus hijas y a su mamá que estaba a su cargo.
Empezó con un pequeño capital de S/. 100.00, vendiendo jugos de frutas por las mañanas y posteriormente implementó un negocio de venta de abarrotes. Actualmente continúa desarrollando ambas actividades, lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su hija y a su mamá. También cuenta con una buena clientela pues les brinda un trato amable.

Con este préstamo de S/.3000.00,  piensa comprar productos que tienen más salida para implementar su negocio como golosinas, bebidas gaseosas, sacos de arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite por cajas, de esa manera mejorará sus ventas y ganancias.
Rosa es una mujer trabajadora,  su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella de realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Brigada Ramírez” communal bank in the district and province of Lamas, within the San Martín department.  She is 54 years old, separated, and lives only with her daughter.  The rest of her children are on their own.

She decided to start this business because at that time her husband was not supporting her financially and she needed to support her youngest daughter.  She started with a small amount of capital, 100 PEN, and began selling fruit juices in the morning and later she started a grocery business.  Currently she is working both businesses and it allowed her to get ahead with her daughter and her mother.  She also has steady customers because she treats them well.

She will use the money from this loan of 3,000 PEN to buy some of the better selling products such as snacks, carbonated drinks, sacks of flower, sugar, milk, and boxes of cooking oil.  In this way she can increase her sales and profits.

Rosa is a hard working woman with a dream of continuing to grow her business.  She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for giving women like her the opportunity to realize their dreams.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Grupo Brisas 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Francisca belongs to the “Grupo Brisas 1 & 2” (Breezes 1 & 2 Group). The group is comprised of ten members. Each one of them works day to day at their business activities. The group is located to the north of the city of Santo Domingo.  They mostly sell clothes, footwear, accessories, cosmetics, food, and other miscellaneous products.

Francisca’s family is maD. up of her long-term partner and their three children. They live in a rented home, which is a simple structure maD. of wood. Her most difficult challenge has been always working to bring in extra income for her family and proviD. for her children's education. She enjoys working and she does this to help her children be able to get ahead, become professionals, get an education, and form their own families.

Francisa’s business is selling bacon and pork. She prepares the meat in order to sell it for a better price and to be able to save more. She has been engaged in this business activity for two and a half years. She tells us that she started thanks to motivation from some friends and some money that she was able to get together with her husband. Then she was able to apply for loans from Esperanza, and she was able to invest. Francisca has now had four loans with Esperanza Internacional. She will use this new loan to buy several pounds of bacon and pork.

Her story is being used to represent the other members of her group. Francisca and her group thank you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy pork to prepare and sell.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
La Sra. Marilú pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Lameñas” del Distrito y Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Está casada, tiene 41 años y 2 hijos en edad escolar.

Se inició vendiendo café molido y maíz, con un capital de S/.1 50.00  para generar sus propios ingresos y poder apoyar económicamente en su hogar. Cuando ingresó al banquito comunal decidió comprar un puesto en el mercado de su localidad y vender verduras. Actualmente cuenta con dos puestos uno de venta de verduras y el otro de abarrotes.

Con este préstamo de S/.3000.00,  comprará  verduras frescas, papas y productos en sacos como arroz, azúcar, leche y conservas enlatados para implementar ambos negocios y de esa manera captar nuevos clientes y mantener satisfechos a su clientela. 

Marilú es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, su sueño es que su negocio continúe creciendo agregando nuevos productos, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por apoyarla y seguir confiando en ella.
texts.en:
Marilú belongs to the Las Lameñas Communal Bank in the Lamas district and province, San Martín department.  She is 41 years old, married, and has two school age children.  

Using 150 soles as working capital she started selling ground coffee and corn in order to generate her own income.  She did this to be able to financially support her household.  When she joined the communal bank she decided to buy a stand to sell vegetables at the local market.  She currently has two stands, one to sell vegetables and the other groceries.

She will use this loan of 3,000 soles to buy fresh vegetables, potatoes, and products in sacks like rice, sugar, milk, and canned goods.  She will do this to stock both businesses.  That way she will get more customers, and she will keep her customers satisfied.

Marilú is a tenacious and enterprising woman.  Her dream is that her business continues growing and adding new products.  She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for supporting her and for continuing to have confidence in her.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, rice, sugar, detergent, milk, and canned goods.

loans.name: María Auxiluadora

texts.es:
En el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y además visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Para  Superar.
